commit_message:
Aggregate create and destroy work against API db

Make aggregate.create() and destroy() use the API rather than cell database.
Also block aggregate creation until main database empty. This makes
Aggregate.create() fail until the main database has had all of its aggreagtes
migrated. Since we want to avoid any overlap or clashes in integer ids we
need to enforce this.

Note that this includes a change to a notification sample, which encodes
the function and module of a sample exception (which happens to be during
an aggregate operation). Since the notifications are encoding internal
function names, which can and will change over time, this is an expected
change.

blueprint cells-aggregate-api-db

Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ida70e3c05f93d6044ddef4fcbc1af999ac1b1944

subject: Handle keypair not found from metadata server
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-15 19:48:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_metadata.py', 'nova/api/metadata/base.py'], 'message': "Handle keypair not found from metadata server

With commit e83842b80b73c451f78a4bb9e7bd5dfcebdefcab we
attempt to load keypairs for an instance from instance_extra,
but if that hasn't been migrated yet we fall back to loading
the keypair from the database by name.

If the keypair was deleted, the instance object will just set
an empty KeyPairList for instance.keypairs and we'll get an
IndexError when using self.instance.keypairs[0] in
_metadata_as_json.

This adds a check that instance.keypairs actually has
something in it. If not, we log a message and don't return
any key values in the metadata dict - same as if instance.key_name
wasn't set to begin with.

Conflicts:
        nova/api/metadata/base.py

NOTE(mriedem): This is basically a different patch given in mitaka
the keypairs weren't migrated to the instance_extra table, so this
is more or less a mitaka-specific fix for the same KeypairNotFound
failure.

Change-Id: If823867d1df4bafa46978e62e05826d1f12c9269
Closes-Bug: #1592167
(cherry picked from commit 4317166b72bb0aadd0321acdf9f2450c1a99d0a4)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle keypair not found from metadata server

With commit e83842b80b73c451f78a4bb9e7bd5dfcebdefcab we
attempt to load keypairs for an instance from instance_extra,
but if that hasn't been migrated yet we fall back to loading
the keypair from the database by name.

If the keypair was deleted, the instance object will just set
an empty KeyPairList for instance.keypairs and we'll get an
IndexError when using self.instance.keypairs[0] in
_metadata_as_json.

This adds a check that instance.keypairs actually has
something in it. If not, we log a message and don't return
any key values in the metadata dict - same as if instance.key_name
wasn't set to begin with.

Conflicts:
        nova/api/metadata/base.py

NOTE(mriedem): This is basically a different patch given in mitaka
the keypairs weren't migrated to the instance_extra table, so this
is more or less a mitaka-specific fix for the same KeypairNotFound
failure.

Change-Id: If823867d1df4bafa46978e62e05826d1f12c9269
Closes-Bug: #1592167
(cherry picked from commit 4317166b72bb0aadd0321acdf9f2450c1a99d0a4)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-19 21:03:46.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/templatetags/context_selection.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/images/tests.py'], 'message': 'Fix project name refresh in project menu bar

When makes an inline update to a project name the name in the menu bar
does not get updated after reloading/refreshing the page. This happens
because the menu display is retrieved from a token in the session which
does not get updated until a switch to a different project is made.

This fix addresses this issue by retrieving project name from the request
context variable authorized_tenants which has updated information instead
of session.

Fix doc string to confirm to pep8. Update template tests to account for
tenant name in menu bar. Tests are not setting session variable for tenant
name so previosuly template did not render active tenant name, this fix
does not use session anymore so tests need to account for it.

Change-Id: Ia0d5b51699197904d1a578d188762ef39a4b67cf
Closes-Bug: 1519577
'}]
commit_message:
Fix project name refresh in project menu bar

When makes an inline update to a project name the name in the menu bar
does not get updated after reloading/refreshing the page. This happens
because the menu display is retrieved from a token in the session which
does not get updated until a switch to a different project is made.

This fix addresses this issue by retrieving project name from the request
context variable authorized_tenants which has updated information instead
of session.

Fix doc string to confirm to pep8. Update template tests to account for
tenant name in menu bar. Tests are not setting session variable for tenant
name so previosuly template did not render active tenant name, this fix
does not use session anymore so tests need to account for it.

Change-Id: Ia0d5b51699197904d1a578d188762ef39a4b67cf
Closes-Bug: 1519577

This patch fix inconsistencies I found:
- python-all / python-all-dev means all available python versions in a

commit_message:
Fix other-requirements.txt for deb based distros

This patch fix inconsistencies I found:
- python-all / python-all-dev means all available python versions in a
given Debian / Ubuntu release. So we shouldn't depend on individual
Python 3.4 or 3.5.
- python{3,}-all-dev already depends on python{3,}-all, so we shouldn't
manually depend on that.
- libldap2-dev isn't needed (and Jenkins success shows it).

Change-Id: I7c2f2f85701457234735bdb4b4e14c139a650b20

commit_message:
self.name doesn't exist in Rate and Counter object

Saw error message in collector log showing:
AttributeError: 'Rate' object has no attribute 'name'

In the new base metric class init function, variable name
got passed into self.metric. That's why self.name doesn't
exist anymore.

Change-Id: Idfd2fe5d257332327449e2766544dd36d8a003c1

commit_message:
Fix NoSuchOptError when referring to conf.neutron.auth_plugin

Backporting to Mitaka

We already replaced 'auth_plugin' with 'auth_type'[1], now an
oslo_config.cfg.NoSuchOptError will be threw up when referring to
conf.neutron.auth_plugin.

This commit replace the usage of conf.neutron.auth_plugin by
conf.neutron.auth_type.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/keystoneauth/commit/a56ed4218aef5a2e528aa682cea967e767dca923

Change-Id: I0b72f278ba8e28508274079ff284042fb9ea3d64
Closes-Bug: #1574988
Closes-Bug: #1604428
(cherry picked from commit 2647f91ae97844a73176fc1c8663d9b186bdec1a)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-29 21:02:50.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_hpe3par.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/fake_hpe_client_exceptions.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_fc.py'], 'message': '3par driver handles concurrent host create conflict

One of the step in creating a FC VLUN is to create a host on array.
When there happens to have simultaneous request for creating same
host, hpe3parclient will create host for one and return HTTP 409
conflict for others, with error code 73, message "host WWN/iSCSI
name already used by another host". This was not handled by 3PAR
driver and the HTTP exception would propagate up to volume manager
where it would log it. This patch addresses this bug by catching
this exception and reusing the same host.

Change-Id: I66e4f80696c782ab869ef0d7848fc6f3b3100c04
Closes-Bug: #1597454
(cherry picked from commit 3c18a2e41ace1144fd53a1223f612e8a15d0b9ff)
'}]
commit_message:
3par driver handles concurrent host create conflict

One of the step in creating a FC VLUN is to create a host on array.
When there happens to have simultaneous request for creating same
host, hpe3parclient will create host for one and return HTTP 409
conflict for others, with error code 73, message "host WWN/iSCSI
name already used by another host". This was not handled by 3PAR
driver and the HTTP exception would propagate up to volume manager
where it would log it. This patch addresses this bug by catching
this exception and reusing the same host.

Change-Id: I66e4f80696c782ab869ef0d7848fc6f3b3100c04
Closes-Bug: #1597454
(cherry picked from commit 3c18a2e41ace1144fd53a1223f612e8a15d0b9ff)

Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim support
for Python 3.5 in the classifier. This patch adds the
convenience py35 venv.

subject: Using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-02 01:33:56.000000000', 'files': ['kolla/cmd/build.py'], 'message': "Using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()

As we known, Exceptions are raised by the sys.exit() function. When they
are not handled, no stack traceback is printed in the Python interpreter.

In this patch we have known main() got return values(eg:0, 1), but
it can't specifies exit status when terminate the main thread by
unusing sys.exit(). So when using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()
may be more readable and reasonable.
TrivialFix.

Change-Id: I184289d28b92a7e345907247c045535a0c42c974
"}]
commit_message:
Using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()

As we known, Exceptions are raised by the sys.exit() function. When they
are not handled, no stack traceback is printed in the Python interpreter.

In this patch we have known main() got return values(eg:0, 1), but
it can't specifies exit status when terminate the main thread by
unusing sys.exit(). So when using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()
may be more readable and reasonable.
TrivialFix.

Change-Id: I184289d28b92a7e345907247c045535a0c42c974

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 19:03:38.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/add-disk-image-type-932898aca944f14a.yaml', 'tasks/tempest_resources.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Allow disk image format to be specified

Change-Id: I5d87917196d1153310b25390da397cd96002174f
Needed-By: Ib49312dcb8fb5bd553369819cfd551137ff1c19e
"}]
commit_message:
Allow disk image format to be specified

This patch set changes the default image
format type from a hard-coded value of 'qcow2'
to the variable ``cirros_img_disk_format``.

This will allow alternate image types to be
specified during automated testing.

Change-Id: I5d87917196d1153310b25390da397cd96002174f
Needed-By: Ib49312dcb8fb5bd553369819cfd551137ff1c19e

commit_message:
Fix broken URL in Mitaka Neutron release note

The section "Other Notes" has a bullet referring to "Please read the OpenStack
Networking Guide." The URL referenced in that bullet was in correct. An
updated URL of
http://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/networking-guide/adv-config-availability-zone.html
was added to the file
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/releasenotes/notes/add-availability-zone-4440cf00be7c54ba.yaml

Change-Id: I3e6f6a6a15705820bc0ed489861465f54e07ae52
Closes-Bug: #1582966
(cherry picked from commit a474eb0cb6ea4bba4cd4ee3144261f1ca3aeb9a6)

commit_message:
Wait for vswitchd to add interfaces in native ovsdb

ovs-vsctl, unless --no-wait is passed, will wait until ovs-vswitchd
has reacted to a successful transaction. This patch implements
the same logic, waiting for next_cfg to be incremented and checking
that any added interfaces have actually been assigned ofports.

Closes-Bug: #1604816
Closes-Bug: #1604370
Related-Bug: #1604115
Change-Id: I638b82c13394f150c0bd23301285bd3375e66139
(cherry picked from commit 11dc21d3a6d765f7bcc95548b55ff13c4397c2e7)

commit_message:
ovsdb: Don't let block() wait indefinitely

Poller.block() calls select() on defined file descriptors. This patch
adds timeout to select() so it doesn't get stuck in case no fd is ready.

Also timeout was added when reading transaction results from queue.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l2_ovs_agent.py

Closes-Bug: 1567668
Change-Id: I7dbddd01409430ce93d8c23f04f02c46fb2a68c4
(cherry picked from commit c13d722f3913137945c27fcc74371d3316129f30)

commit_message:
Fix for check_vlan_transparency on mech drivers not called

The check_vlan_transparency method on mech drivers is never
called by the neutron/plugins/ml2/managers.py MechanismManager
_check_vlan_transparency method since that method is invoked
before 'vlan_transparent' has been set in the context.
This fix moves the block in neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py
ML2Plugin._create_network_db to before the call to
'self.mechanism_manager.create_network_precommit(mech_context)'
so that vlan_transparent exists in the context when the
MechanismManager checks.

Change-Id: I8e47ccdebf0cb954109195e8a8ba39a1c82f97a8
Closes-Bug: #1602294
(cherry picked from commit 09736ed06436330d81786bc8ced8a681b14f17a7)

commit_message:
ScaleIO ignore rename of external volumes

ScaleIO driver will ignore rename of volumes that
are from other backend.
This is fixing a bug that migration is failed if you
involve another backend.

Also, added another value of volume not found error
that belongs to older ScaleIO versions.

Closes-Bug: #1604703
Change-Id: I70dc8c3013c31c50fbcce7f3ff0b3ea677cf4f34

commit_message:
Fix documentation and remove dead code

In the last review of the VMEM iSCSI some review comments were deferred
for a follow-on checkin. This change addresses those comments. It
includes some documentation changes and one code change. The code change
pertains to removal of dead code.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1604151

commit_message:
Set prefix on floating_ip_mangle rules

Set the /32 prefix that iptables will automatically do internally
so our format matches the iptables-save format and we don't
unnecessarily re-apply rules.

Testing for this is provided by enabling the IPTables convergence
check in I6bee1d51155488e91857ee8bc45470d6a224fa37

Closes-Bug: #1607699
Change-Id: I0088636d2f8409f0f6f17b3ed2288f6edfac1e68

subject: Improve repo_build tests for upper-constraints
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 23:18:48.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-repo-build.yml'], 'message': "Improve repo_build tests for upper-constraints

The current testing takes content like 'django-nose===1.4.4' and creates
a key:value pair of 'django-nose:1.4.4', then uses that for testing.

The trouble comes in with upper-constraints like:

dnspython===1.14.0
dnspython3===1.12.0;python_version=='3.4'

In this scenario one overwrites the other because the key is the same.

This patch implements a list with the full line as it's expected to
be found so that this problem doesn't happen.

Change-Id: Ic96185d217c2f0256dcde753d972e4e9de166224
"}]
commit_message:
Improve repo_build tests for upper-constraints

The current testing takes content like 'django-nose===1.4.4' and creates
a key:value pair of 'django-nose:1.4.4', then uses that for testing.

The trouble comes in with upper-constraints like:

dnspython===1.14.0
dnspython3===1.12.0;python_version=='3.4'

In this scenario one overwrites the other because the key is the same.

This patch implements a list with the full line as it's expected to
be found so that this problem doesn't happen.

Change-Id: Ic96185d217c2f0256dcde753d972e4e9de166224

commit_message:
Fix bug in RPC config that broke Rabbit SSL support

The use_rabbit_ssl query parameter is not respected by
oslo.messaging's rabbit driver, only the pika driver
supports configuration using query parameters at present.

Change-Id: I397b56423d9ef6757bada27c92b7c9f0d5126cc9
Implements: blueprint multi-rabbitmq-clusters

subject: Nested new() were not using 2-phase load
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-08-02 17:31:27.000000000', 'files': ['murano/dsl/murano_object.py', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/meta/CreatingClass.yaml', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/test_construction.py', 'murano/dsl/object_store.py'], 'message': 'Nested new() were not using 2-phase load

Usually object model load happens in two phases. This is also true for
new($model) that does the same at run time. However if the new()
happens to be in .init method that is executed as part of object model
itself it becomes nested model load. However due to the bug instead of
starting another 2-phase session, new() used to join the same session
.init run in (second pass of the outer load). Thus cross object
references within the nested model were not resolved.

Closes-Bug: #1608718
Change-Id: I81396291c3beaee8b0c5b50879313cc236a5aa77
'}]
commit_message:
Nested new() were not using 2-phase load

Usually object model load happens in two phases. This is also true for
new($model) that does the same at run time. However if the new()
happens to be in .init method that is executed as part of object model
itself it becomes nested model load. However due to the bug instead of
starting another 2-phase session, new() used to join the same session
.init run in (second pass of the outer load). Thus cross object
references within the nested model were not resolved.

Closes-Bug: #1608718
Change-Id: I81396291c3beaee8b0c5b50879313cc236a5aa77

subject: Duplicate objects were instantiated for redeclared properties
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-02 17:30:39.000000000', 'files': ['murano/dsl/murano_object.py', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/meta/CreatingClass.yaml', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/test_construction.py'], 'message': "Duplicate objects were instantiated for redeclared properties

When child class redeclares class() property from the parent class
(usually, it is done to narrow the contract but it doesn't really matter
here) and a dictionary value (object definition) was assigned to this
property instead of being instantiated once and then checked against
the contract the object is instantiated (N^2 + N)/2 times,
possibly with different IDs and .init is called each time.

Closes-Bug: #1608713
Change-Id: I48623df3f812eeae059f138671f8cb676404a275
"}]
commit_message:
Duplicate objects were instantiated for redeclared properties

When child class redeclares class() property from the parent class
(usually, it is done to narrow the contract but it doesn't really matter
here) and a dictionary value (object definition) was assigned to this
property instead of being instantiated once and then checked against
the contract the object is instantiated (N^2 + N)/2 times,
possibly with different IDs and .init is called each time.

Closes-Bug: #1608713
Change-Id: I48623df3f812eeae059f138671f8cb676404a275

This patch is a conceptual implementation of bp
eventually-consistent-scheduler-host-state to testify its design goals
in accuracy, performance, reliability and compatibility improvements.

To run and test this prototype, download this patch and set
`scheduler_host_manager=shared_host_manager` in "nova.conf". Do not

commit_message:
WIP: Eventually consistent host state prototype

This patch is a conceptual implementation of bp
eventually-consistent-scheduler-host-state to testify its design goals
in accuracy, performance, reliability and compatibility improvements.

To run and test this prototype, download this patch and set
`scheduler_host_manager=shared_host_manager` in "nova.conf". Do not
forget to update "nova/nova.egg-info/entry_points.txt" according to the
modified "setup.cfg". Also note: Multiple scheduler instances can only
run on separate machines, and this prototype supports filter schedulers
and caching schedulers running at the same time.

In order to be flexible with design changes and quick prototyping, there
are still no unit tests. They will be added once the general idea is
accepted and the design is confirmed with spec.

For discussions and detailed explanation, please refer to the maillist:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-February/thread.html#86516
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-March/thread.html#87889

If you find any bugs, please paste your detailed log information to
http://paste.openstack.org/ and reply here.

Related to blueprint eventually-consistent-scheduler-host-state
Change-Id: I6432197c0c52a445f75d5d801fe8722e67da1aff

commit_message:
Neutron control bootstraps and runs without host network

* Neutron control service runs as a replication controller
* Fixed bootstrap to connect to the MariaDB service
* Config files are fixed for Kubernetes with underscores
* Fixed bugs in bootstrap
* Fixed typo in service_resources.yaml
* Preserving the existing behavior (keystone_database_address
  / neutron_database_address, but all on the same port number)
  as Kolla-Ansible

Current config file:

api_interface_address: "0.0.0.0"

memcached_servers: "memcached"

keystone_database_address: "mariadb"
neutron_database_address: "mariadb"
keystone_admin_url: "http://keystone-admin:35357/v3"
keystone_internal_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"
keystone_public_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"
glance_registry_host: "glance-registry"
glance_database_address: "mariadb"
enable_rabbitmq_cluster: "no"

commit_message:
Adding Fuxi as a Kuryr sub-project

Fuxi intends to provide Openstack storage for Docker, and Kuryr intends to
provide Openstack network to Docker, so Fuxi and Kuryr want to bind as
a package which links Openstack and Docker.

Change-Id: I514f95e41a6188ebfbc41b51fc452b223d4ca482

commit_message:
Support 'shelve' and 'reboot' instance notifications

Both 'shelve/unshelve' and 'reboot' actions fire off several nova
actions which affect state and we should listen to them.

Change-Id: I1ddc494cda4729f54ea813b462918af2cb3fdc9b
Closes-bug: #1596716

subject: Remove the ansible-role 'func' experimental jobs from openstack-ansible
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 13:09:35.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Remove the ansible-role 'func' experimental jobs from openstack-ansible

With the implementation of https://review.openstack.org/329892 which
uses the script-builder, instead of tox, the tox-based 'func' jobs
are no longer required.

Unfortunately the tox-based jobs were not suitable for the integrated
build which needs to be executed using the script builder to make it
a reasonable approximation of how a deployment is executed in a
production environment.

Change-Id: I8cf533c1b0e2e5c1c32887da6b567a9b8d90c3f7
"}]
commit_message:
Remove the ansible-role 'func' experimental jobs from openstack-ansible

With the implementation of https://review.openstack.org/329892 which
uses the script-builder, instead of tox, the tox-based 'func' jobs
are no longer required.

Unfortunately the tox-based jobs were not suitable for the integrated
build which needs to be executed using the script builder to make it
a reasonable approximation of how a deployment is executed in a
production environment.

Change-Id: I8cf533c1b0e2e5c1c32887da6b567a9b8d90c3f7

commit_message:
Allow tox to be run with python 3

The tox.ini has some unicode characters that cannot be
decoded, so just executing tox will immediately cause an error
because the tox.ini cannot be parsed.

Conflicts:
	tox.ini

Change-Id: I32a53cc4b019445f1f7a1dca847f14eba4bda81c
Closes-Bug: #1600068
(cherry picked from commit 7f87f63911e1a10519d7b1da160cf55fbd4335cc)

commit_message:
Run console on the serial port if required

This commit adds the ability to use IPMI SOL console when the nodes
provisioned with an option 'console=ttySx' or 'console=ttySx,speed',
where x is 0 for the COM1 and 1 for COM2. If speed parameter doesn't
provided so 9600 used as default. This feature can be used for the
bootstrap nodes too.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1544820
Change-Id: I210001c5692281add2439843f4ad69d65c8f6e17
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Add Neutron context module and some policy methods

Here we add the context module from Neutron, although it is
currently marked as private because it will undergo changes
related to the ongoing enginefacade and Keystone V3 work.

We also add some of the roles management methods from
Neutron's policy module. These are required for the initial
DB patches that follow this one.

Partially implements: Blueprint neutron-lib

Change-Id: I77f8a05d6e3167f3096ad637d124e47ac39a83df

subject: Fix string interpolation to delayed by logging
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-02 10:42:15.000000000', 'files': ['murano/common/plugins/extensions_loader.py'], 'message': 'Fix string interpolation to delayed by logging

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging
code, rather than being done at the point of the logging call.

See the oslo i18n guideline.
* http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

References: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/339268

Change-Id: Ie4ea466f951db796fd85277c52be40018dfb01ac
Closes-Bug:#1596829
'}]
commit_message:
Fix string interpolation to delayed by logging

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging
code, rather than being done at the point of the logging call.

See the oslo i18n guideline.
* http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

References: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/339268

Change-Id: Ie4ea466f951db796fd85277c52be40018dfb01ac
Closes-Bug:#1596829

commit_message:
L2-Adjacency support

The following patch adds the support for L2-Adjacency to indicate if
there is L2 adjacency between the ports on a network.

Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

Change-Id: Id2d4331568886bee52e78e1c138f1475cc89342b

subject: Break out bootstrapping of subnodes setup
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-28 20:47:18.000000000', 'files': ['toci_instack_osinfra.sh', 'scripts/tripleo.sh'], 'message': 'Break out bootstrapping of subnodes setup

The boostrap-overcloud-full.sh script is broken out into its own
function in tripleo.sh as it is often useful to run just the networking
part of the multinode setup separate from the subnode bootstrapping.

The script also creates a lot of output, and has to be run for each
subnode.  This change redirects all that output to a logfile so it is
not as verbose in the jenkins console. Since a pipe is used to redirect
to a logfile, toci_instack_osinfra.sh now also enables the pipefail
option.

Change-Id: I2b84b3dfae60bbe7d6a76259b1d718b7dda08739
'}]
commit_message:
Break out bootstrapping of subnodes setup

The boostrap-overcloud-full.sh script is broken out into its own
function in tripleo.sh as it is often useful to run just the networking
part of the multinode setup separate from the subnode bootstrapping.

The script also creates a lot of output, and has to be run for each
subnode.  This change redirects all that output to a logfile so it is
not as verbose in the jenkins console. Since a pipe is used to redirect
to a logfile, toci_instack_osinfra.sh now also enables the pipefail
option.

Change-Id: I2b84b3dfae60bbe7d6a76259b1d718b7dda08739

commit_message:
Generate and include sample config as part of docs

Use oslo.config sphinx extension "sphinxconfiggen" to generate sample
configuration files at the beginning of each sphinx build. Include the
generated sample configuration files as part of the developer docs so
that they can be removed from the code tree eventually.

Change-Id: I42934a437272b3822efd84bfe16392341804baed
Co-Authored-By: Nikhil Komawar <nik.komawar@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Hemanth Makkapati <hemanth.makkapati@rackspace.com>

subject: Lock fast_gettext to something that isn't 1.2.0.
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-02 20:03:00.000000000', 'files': ['puppet-openstack_spec_helper.gemspec', 'lib/puppet-openstack_spec_helper/beaker_spec_helper.rb'], 'message': "Lock fast_gettext to something that isn't 1.2.0.

  This commit makes sure that fast_gettext is a version less than 1.2.0
  to prevent a version to be installed that requires Ruby 2.1.0 or
  greater.

  This is being done to solve an issue where the new version of
  fast_gettext requires a version of Ruby and is not available on EL 7.

  Additionally, temporarily pre-install fast_gettext 1.1.0 while the
  necessary change lands in puppet-openstack-integration.

Change-Id: Ic175170c9cf1d6d093fee63eaf139d347e0f6f81
Closes-Bug: #1609081
Co-Authored-By: Cody Herriges <cody@herriges.org>
Co-Authored-By: David Moreau Simard <dms@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Lock fast_gettext to something that isn't 1.2.0.

  This commit makes sure that fast_gettext is a version less than 1.2.0
  to prevent a version to be installed that requires Ruby 2.1.0 or
  greater.

  This is being done to solve an issue where the new version of
  fast_gettext requires a version of Ruby and is not available on EL 7.

  Additionally, temporarily pre-install fast_gettext 1.1.0 while the
  necessary change lands in puppet-openstack-integration.

Change-Id: Ic175170c9cf1d6d093fee63eaf139d347e0f6f81
Closes-Bug: #1609081
Co-Authored-By: Cody Herriges <cody@herriges.org>
Co-Authored-By: David Moreau Simard <dms@redhat.com>

subject: Pre-install fast_gettext before r10k, disable Zaqar
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-08-02 20:00:52.000000000', 'files': ['install_modules.sh', 'fixtures/scenario002.pp'], 'message': "Pre-install fast_gettext before r10k, disable Zaqar

This commit is squashed to resolve ongoing CI issues.

There is an issue installing r10k on EL7 right now:
fast_gettext requires Ruby version >= 2.1.0.

Zaqar is now blocking us since a patch in Tempest.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/294425/

We'll re-enable later.

Change-Id: Id56b0ae6511a550713f3edcd7fbc563b34315796
Closes-Bug: #1609081
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: David Moreau Simard <dms@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Pre-install fast_gettext before r10k, disable Zaqar

This commit is squashed to resolve ongoing CI issues.

There is an issue installing r10k on EL7 right now:
fast_gettext requires Ruby version >= 2.1.0.

Zaqar is now blocking us since a patch in Tempest.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/294425/

We'll re-enable later.

Change-Id: Id56b0ae6511a550713f3edcd7fbc563b34315796
Closes-Bug: #1609081
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: David Moreau Simard <dms@redhat.com>

Change-Id: If7647ac54ed13a5cfa706f7b9824ae82422f0eb9
"}]
commit_message:
Force disable heat on devstack slaves

Murano CI doesn't use heat stack on devstack slaves. It's better to
disable heat services, it will decrease time of slave setup and speed
up gate work.

Change-Id: If7647ac54ed13a5cfa706f7b9824ae82422f0eb9

This adds an optimized object call to get a list of instance uuids
currently running on a given host. This allows much more efficient

Change-Id: Iec6ada1fe7da9a02ccd8eb7ec74391a92f2f046d

commit_message:
Add InstanceList.get_uuids_by_host() call

This adds an optimized object call to get a list of instance uuids
currently running on a given host. This allows much more efficient
behavior for remote nodes that merely need to do resource reporting
and just need to know what assigned instances they have.

Change-Id: Iec6ada1fe7da9a02ccd8eb7ec74391a92f2f046d

subject: Fix untranslated help text in Launch Instance window
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-02 01:29:34.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/source/source.help.html', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/security-groups/security-groups.help.html'], 'message': "Fix untranslated help text in Launch Instance window - Source tab Flow context is not allowed to write to inner phrasing content, At the moment untranslation is occurred by a incorrect value of .html().

  • yyy

    • -> elem.html() // value is ''

    xxx

  • yyy

    • -> elem.html() // value is 'xxx' This phenomenon is caused by below. html in html file

  • yyy
    • xxx

    html rendered in browser

  • yyy

    • - Security Groups tab '&' needs html escape Change-Id: Ic414d232063cc12333ac2d70fd8f351a35a00b6d Closes-Bug: #1561558 "}]
commit_message:
Fix untranslated help text in Launch Instance window - Source tab Flow context is not allowed to write to inner phrasing content, At the moment untranslation is occurred by a incorrect value of .html().

  • yyy

    • -> elem.html() // value is ''

    xxx

  • yyy

    • -> elem.html() // value is 'xxx' This phenomenon is caused by below. html in html file

  • yyy
    • xxx

    html rendered in browser

  • yyy

    • - Security Groups tab '&' needs html escape Change-Id: Ic414d232063cc12333ac2d70fd8f351a35a00b6d Closes-Bug: #1561558

commit_message:
Refactoring config options of agent/common/ovs_lib

Refactoring oslo config options for agent/common/ovs_lib
in neutron/conf/agent/ovs_conf. This would allow centralization of
all configuration options and provides easy way to import.

Change-Id: If833a52efc0da406d0ee24fcc5dd4e05898aa094

Tasks can be downloaded in JSON format for a single graph
or for a merged graph by its type

Implements blueprint ui-custom-graph

commit_message:
Move helper methods for object_storage to base.py

Move the create_container and create_object methods
out of test files into base.py to reduce code
duplication.
Same pattern as in other base.py files.

Refactored setUp and cleanUp methods.

Change-Id: Ibec4e6a7e4e544a2311d5c44af17103854c78021

commit_message:
devstack change to set default vim via cli command

We can set default vim via cli command. So we don't need
default_vim setting in tacker.conf

Change-Id: Ib7b65f20674ffa215869f96177f6ece63fad9a99
Partial-Bug: 1592957

Prepare for fuel-devops 2.9.22 API changes

Use intermediate layers while test adoptation in process.
Mark as deprecated methods, which is completely covered by
devops implementation.

commit_message:
Fix usage of inaccessible SSHClient APIs

['stdout_str'] and ['stderr_str'] is accessible
on all SSHClient output (except async) only starting
from 2.9.22 and currently we using 2.9.21
Solution: roll-back part of changes from review 344612

Change-Id: I2ab955dd42a5b5db102236c7468f029bd89e3bc6

subject: Only coerce glance properties we know need it
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 13:50:35.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/relaxed-glance-coersion-4ec8fb5593df0c2d.yaml', 'shade/tests/unit/test_caching.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Only coerce glance properties we know need it

We have been coercing all glance properties for v2 put into strings,
with the exception of two entires that we turn into ints. This is
problematic for people who want custom int property fields

Change the behavior to convert the four known int fields to int and
leave everything else alone.

Change-Id: I15a53a0a3c8b71def4ea92c5f9e7152b251ae6e3
'}]
commit_message:
Only coerce glance properties we know need it

We have been coercing all glance properties for v2 put into strings,
with the exception of two entires that we turn into ints. This is
problematic for people who want custom int property fields

Change the behavior to convert the four known int fields to int and
leave everything else alone.

Change-Id: I15a53a0a3c8b71def4ea92c5f9e7152b251ae6e3

subject: Add ability to provide direct glance metadata
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-01 22:07:25.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Add ability to provide direct glance metadata

We coerce data as per datatype for glance v2, but for operator provided
metadata values, we have no idea if they are str or int. Allow a path
that avoids doing the coersion.

Change-Id: Iaf26bda56a1bce8a3c3c0d4e615f738c578946ca
'}]
commit_message:
Add ability to provide direct glance metadata

We coerce data as per datatype for glance v2, but for operator provided
metadata values, we have no idea if they are str or int. Allow a path
that avoids doing the coersion.

Change-Id: Iaf26bda56a1bce8a3c3c0d4e615f738c578946ca

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-29 13:41:59.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_local_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/fip_rule_priority_allocator.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_ip_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_local_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_fip_rule_priority_allocator.py'], 'message': 'Use single priority for floating IP rules

The logic to delete the IP rules associated with floating IPs
was based entirely on the priority of the rule rather than the
IP address itself. This resulted in an entire
FipRulePriorityAllocator system which had the role of making sure
that a single floating IP would get a specific priority.

However, we can just delete the IP rule directly based on the
floating IP itself so this system to manage rule priorities is
unnecessary and we can just assign the same priority to all
floating IP rules. This significantly simplifies the code.

Change-Id: I20bab481eee6ee442a2713e9257175257730631c
'}]
commit_message:
Use single priority for floating IP rules

The logic to delete the IP rules associated with floating IPs
was based entirely on the priority of the rule rather than the
IP address itself. This resulted in an entire
FipRulePriorityAllocator system which had the role of making sure
that a single floating IP would get a specific priority.

However, we can just delete the IP rule directly based on the
floating IP itself so this system to manage rule priorities is
unnecessary and we can just assign the same priority to all
floating IP rules. This significantly simplifies the code.

Change-Id: I20bab481eee6ee442a2713e9257175257730631c

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-13 20:24:25.000000000', 'files': ['other-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Fix python{3,}-all-dev depends in deb based

This fixes inconsistencies in other-requirements.txt. For example,
python3-all-dev depends on python3-all, so we don't need to manually
install python3-all if we install python3-all-dev. python3-all means
all version of python3 available in the system, so we shouldn't

Change-Id: Iaaaa2b137c1b751f8383ba21343dcc704c868187
"}]
commit_message:
Fix python{3,}-all-dev depends in deb based

This fixes inconsistencies in other-requirements.txt. For example,
python3-all-dev depends on python3-all, so we don't need to manually
install python3-all if we install python3-all-dev. python3-all means
all version of python3 available in the system, so we shouldn't
manually install python3.4 or 3.5. Also, using [platform:ubuntu-
is a bad idea (ie: it wont work in Debian).

Change-Id: Iaaaa2b137c1b751f8383ba21343dcc704c868187

commit_message:
[wip] Support launchpad auth and acl

Implementation is based on python-openid library. Both session and
openid data are stored in memcached.
Access for some api methods and some UI elements is allowed only for
members of specified launchpad groups.

Change-Id: Idd05f1b72521502d527430cc7a7f19e1d3633224

horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.heattop.js file.

I've decided to only fix those errors here to keep the patch small, and

commit_message:
No eslint errors in horizon.heattop.js

Running eslint is effectively useless nowdays because of the
overwhelming number of warnings returned.

This patch fixes the existing "no-use-before-define" errors in the
horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.heattop.js file.

I've decided to only fix those errors here to keep the patch small, and
not destroy any chance of success by needing to rebase every 5 minutes.
Other fixes will be incoming.

Change-Id: I347a472a0eac2e35df14e48f28403a3b8a243c57

commit_message:
zuul/tripleo: move undercloud job to check pipeline

We managed to make the undercloud job working in experimental pipeline.
This patch aims to move it to the check pipeline.

It is not clear if we will keep this job in the future, as we are
working on a undercloud upgrade job. Though until we get there, this is
a first iteration of having a job that only deploys an undercloud.

Once we stabilize it, we will enable voting on it.

Change-Id: Ifcaaa7acaa9dedaf90b4cb0e604aeb7ad7bd0b34

commit_message:
Fix recordset changes so that they preserve object changes fields

Previous to this patch, the multiple actions on `recordset.records`
was causing the changes fields to lose changes.

Here's a log of the unit tests failing on master:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/543432/

Change-Id: I07832777595d45e6c941fcc9b80aa104ffab1645

commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: I2293575ad0422f546a2c4750f002955d75beb4d8

subject: Add adapter teaming support using teamd for ifcfg-systems
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-25 21:34:02.000000000', 'files': ['os_net_config/tests/test_impl_ifcfg.py', 'os_net_config/tests/test_objects.py', 'os_net_config/impl_ifcfg.py', 'os_net_config/__init__.py', 'etc/os-net-config/samples/team.json', 'etc/os-net-config/samples/team.yaml', 'os_net_config/objects.py'], 'message': 'Add adapter teaming support using teamd for ifcfg-systems

This change adds support for Linux adapter teams using teamd to
manage the bonds instead of the kernel bonding module. Adapter
teams using teamd can act like bonds, but also support additional
features and possibly more robust fault tolerance.

This implementation is fairly straightforward, in order to maintain
backward compatibility with templates made for Linux bonds. The only
difference in the syntax between the two is type: team instead of
type: linux_bond, and the bonding_options format is different.

The configuration files for teams should contain the team options
as a JSON string. The options that can be used are documented in
the teamd.conf(5) man page.

If an interface is marked as primary, the priority will be changed
from default 0 to 100, making this interface the preferred one. In
addition, the MAC address of the Team and all member interfaces will
be set to that of the primary interface. At this time, there is no
way to set the priority of link members individually, only the
interface marked primary will have a non-default priority.

This change has been tested on bare metal and worked for a team
with two bonded interfaces using LACP. The team was part of an
OVS bridge, and there was a VLAN interface on the team. Everything
worked as expected. Unit tests are included and passing.

Change-Id: If1d516ce8f9ada76375c3a52c5557d3f7348981a
Implements: blueprint os-net-config-teaming'}]
commit_message:
Add adapter teaming support using teamd for ifcfg-systems

This change adds support for Linux adapter teams using teamd to
manage the bonds instead of the kernel bonding module. Adapter
teams using teamd can act like bonds, but also support additional
features and possibly more robust fault tolerance.

This implementation is fairly straightforward, in order to maintain
backward compatibility with templates made for Linux bonds. The only
difference in the syntax between the two is type: team instead of
type: linux_bond, and the bonding_options format is different.

The configuration files for teams should contain the team options
as a JSON string. The options that can be used are documented in
the teamd.conf(5) man page.

If an interface is marked as primary, the priority will be changed
from default 0 to 100, making this interface the preferred one. In
addition, the MAC address of the Team and all member interfaces will
be set to that of the primary interface. At this time, there is no
way to set the priority of link members individually, only the
interface marked primary will have a non-default priority.

This change has been tested on bare metal and worked for a team
with two bonded interfaces using LACP. The team was part of an
OVS bridge, and there was a VLAN interface on the team. Everything
worked as expected. Unit tests are included and passing.

Change-Id: If1d516ce8f9ada76375c3a52c5557d3f7348981a
Implements: blueprint os-net-config-teaming

commit_message:
Resync charm helpers for PG calc fixes

When the Ceph RADOS Gateway is used with small OSD configurations
(3 OSDs), the light pools consume 0.1% of storage by default; this
results in PG counts below or equal to 0; enforce a minimum PG count
of 2 as specified in the official Ceph PG calculator.

Change-Id: I44748807540ddde1ac76493bd85bb0f1c708e16c
Closes-Bug: 1607961
(cherry picked from commit 9b37f57e45d5b311fa345e1116c41349379855d8)

commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: I896ef4f57afa55f52b05799efce2ef370f31dee0

commit_message:
use Config instead of individual args with parameters

Instead of passing an increasing number of arguments around through the
system, set up the Config instance correctly and use it.

Also make the reporoot a required argument for Config, and let the
release note subdirectory be an optional argument with a default.

Change-Id: I5fc6358bb496f44e3fd68c89ad71b06067dd7425
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

A few task names are cosmetically changed to better reflect their
purpose.

Change-Id: I827b5b07aa7b441e866e042355775a6ff8566920

commit_message:
Fix gate test failures

The horizon settings have changed and the corresponding changes
were not picked up the trove-dashboard.  Import the horizon settings
file to prevent code skew and add the panels to the list of
installed apps.

commit_message:
Try out artifact signing job for bindep releases

Sign and upload signatures for bindep release sdist tarballs and
wheels. This is a temporary configuration to iron out any lingering
bugs before adding the job to the publish-to-pypi project-template
for use by everyone.

commit_message:
Run a set of lightweight neutron jobs on upper-constraints.txt changes

The following neutron jobs are added to gate upper-constraints.txt
changes:

- docs
- pep8
- python27
- python34

This should be a good start to guard the file changes before they break
project gates.

Those jobs will be executed only when the file is changed, otherwise
skipped.

Change-Id: If89eea81f748021d6b88781079e7da7d054b3415

Restrict the length of bay's name to avoid passing a invalid long name
to heat stack.

Reason of 242 is:
stack_name = '%s-%s' % (bay.name, short_id.generate_id())
255 - len(short_id.generate_id()) - 1 = 242

Change-Id: If22a9018ece718f014c40e8059b945ae1a411f5b
"}]
commit_message:
API: restrict length of bay's name to 242

Restrict the length of bay's name to avoid passing a invalid long name
to heat stack.

Reason of 242 is:
stack_name = '%s-%s' % (bay.name, short_id.generate_id())
255 - len(short_id.generate_id()) - 1 = 242

Closes-bug: #1606785
Change-Id: If22a9018ece718f014c40e8059b945ae1a411f5b

commit_message:
Remove X-IO volume driver

The X-IO CI has not reported on a patch since 2016-03-18 20:23:25.
This is well past our policy for CI reporting.

Per Cinder's non-compliance policy [1] this patch removes the driver
and will be approved if the issue is not corrected within one week.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Cinder/tested-3rdParty-drivers#Non-Compliance_Policy

Change-Id: Ia892eddeff21e63ac3ff286a35d2d0f629a907d9

commit_message:
Add support for the audit middleware

This adds support for the audit middleware to Ironic, allowing
the middleware to send two notifications per API request,
one for the request and another for the response.
This adds an option to enable or disable audit middleware.
Also to properly audit API requests passing conf options
via audit map file.

AuditMiddleware docs:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystonemiddleware/audit.html

Co-Authored-By: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1540232
Change-Id: I6de4751aa6b25e8457cae3eeab95a15f417662c5

commit_message:
Flavor: correct confusing error message about flavorRef

There was a try/except block that was not used anymore since the
schema check catches invalid input. Raise a FlavorNotFound exception
when an invalid flavor is provided.

Change-Id: I76be8942d59b408c7512658968cdb12733772ead

subject: [Django 1.10] Define TEMPLATES
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-19 07:39:56.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_auth/tests/settings.py'], 'message': "[Django 1.10] Define TEMPLATES

In Django 1.10, one *must* define TEMPLATES, and set the BACKEND
APP_DIRS to True. If this isn't done, the package cannot find
its html templates.

Change-Id: Ic4d238ad42931d71da00b468c5f9fd205fa9d4e6
"}]
commit_message:
[Django 1.10] Define TEMPLATES

In Django 1.10, one *must* define TEMPLATES, and set the BACKEND
APP_DIRS to True. If this isn't done, the package cannot find
its html templates.

Change-Id: Ic4d238ad42931d71da00b468c5f9fd205fa9d4e6

subject: Move data-driven-upgrade test imports from run_tests.py
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 14:23:55.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/tests/tests_upgrade/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Move data-driven-upgrade test imports from run_tests.py

Old-way test import produces merge conflict each time when new test
is added for suite and cherry-picked from mitaka to 8.0 branch.
Moving imports out of run_tests.py removes this behaviour.

Test discovering mechanism used in mitaka and master branch ignores
imports in __init__ file.

Change-Id: Ic822afc1f4ef8d65800fed379b0840320566c398
'}]
commit_message:
Move data-driven-upgrade test imports from run_tests.py

Old-way test import produces merge conflict each time when new test
is added for suite and cherry-picked from mitaka to 8.0 branch.
Moving imports out of run_tests.py removes this behaviour.

Test discovering mechanism used in mitaka and master branch ignores
imports in __init__ file.

Change-Id: Ic822afc1f4ef8d65800fed379b0840320566c398

commit_message:
Move data-driven-upgrade test imports from run_tests.py

Old-way test import produces merge conflict each time when new test
is added for suite and cherry-picked from mitaka to 8.0 branch.
Moving imports out of run_tests.py removes this behaviour.

Test discovering mechanism used in mitaka and master branch ignores
imports in __init__ file.

Change-Id: Ic822afc1f4ef8d65800fed379b0840320566c398

commit_message:
Use keystone library for heat_stack_domain_admin

The keystone library has been updated to support adding a user to a
domain and assigning a role without specifying a project.
Use it instead of shelling out to the openstackclient.

Backport for change I2659f0496528c29e036c459494a463182e69599d

Closes-Bug: 1579612
Depends-On: If515ec94e980365ebd38781498ee541df2f3d431
Change-Id: I79ac6820c03ddbb2df33d123bddfa917613f033d

commit_message:
Move data-driven-upgrade test imports from run_tests.py

Old-way test import produces merge conflict each time when new test
is added for suite and cherry-picked from mitaka to 8.0 branch.
Moving imports out of run_tests.py removes this behaviour.

Test discovering mechanism used in mitaka and master branch ignores
imports in __init__ file.

Change-Id: Ic822afc1f4ef8d65800fed379b0840320566c398

commit_message:
Merged metrics_engine package into decision_engine

In this changeset, I merged the metrics_engine package into
the decision_engine one alongside the required changes to make
the tests pass.

Change-Id: Iac1cd266a854212bf4fa8b21c744b076c3b834a8
Partially-Implements: blueprint cluster-model-objects-wrapper

commit_message:
Updated DE architecture doc + 'period' param

In this changeset, I updated the architecture documentation
about the Decision Engine by adding a new sequence diagram
outlining the CDM synchronization workflow.
I also explained the default 'period' parameter used in the
CDMC plugin.

Change-Id: I09790281ba9117e302ab8e66a887667929c6c261
Partially-Implements: blueprint cluster-model-objects-wrapper

commit_message:
Added DE Background Scheduler w/ model sync jobs

In this changeset, I implemented a background scheduler service
for Watcher and more particularly for the Decision Engine where
I made it create 2 types of job per cluster data model collector
plugin:

- An initial job that is asynchronously executed upon starting the
  Decision Engine
- A periodical job that gets triggered every configurable interval
  of time

Change-Id: I3f5442f81933a19565217b894bd86c186e339762
Partially-Implements: bluprint cluster-model-objects-wrapper

commit_message:
Cluster data model collector plugin documentation

In this changeset, I wrote down the documentation on how to implement
a cluster data model collector plugin for Watcher.

This documentation corresponds to part 1 of the associated
specification.

Change-Id: Iac72b933df95252163033cd559d13348075a9b16
Partially-Implements: blueprint cluster-model-objects-wrapper

commit_message:
Loadable Cluster Data Model Collectors

In this changeset, I made BaseClusterDataModelCollector instances
pluggable. This corresponds to "part 1" of the work items detailed
in the specifications.

Change-Id: Iab1c7e264add9e2cbbbb767e3fd6e99a0c22c691
Partially-Implements: blueprint cluster-model-objects-wrapper

subject: Add ability to change apt/yum package state
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 14:03:45.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/install-apt.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/package-state-63a870de53dd5cd8.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: I1708ca8285ffa2bbd1a989b187ef3c6d9dd005c2
'}]
commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: I1708ca8285ffa2bbd1a989b187ef3c6d9dd005c2

subject: Ensure that mode is a string
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-02 08:51:33.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/neutron_init_systemd.yml'], 'message': "Ensure that mode is a string

With Ansible 2.x the mode parameter must lead with a zero. When
a number is not quoted it may be read as an integer instead of a
string, thus losing the leading zero.

This patch ensures that the mode parameter is explicitly quoted.

The task names are also adjusted to remove the unnecessary mention
of 'neutron' in the task. This is simply a cosmetic normalisation.

The tags which were recently added are also removed as they do not
conform to the agreed tag standard set.

Change-Id: Ibf0cc334ea3643660020654eaac17aeeb69973fe
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that mode is a string

With Ansible 2.x the mode parameter must lead with a zero. When
a number is not quoted it may be read as an integer instead of a
string, thus losing the leading zero.

This patch ensures that the mode parameter is explicitly quoted.

The task names are also adjusted to remove the unnecessary mention
of 'neutron' in the task. This is simply a cosmetic normalisation.

The tags which were recently added are also removed as they do not
conform to the agreed tag standard set.

Change-Id: Ibf0cc334ea3643660020654eaac17aeeb69973fe

subject: Set the default link property to allow message acks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-25 13:08:13.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqp1_driver/controller.py'], 'message': "Set the default link property to allow message acks

Previously the default snd-settle-mode caused the sender to assume the
message would not be acknowledged so the sender never waited for an
acknowledgement.  The 'mixed' setting allows the sender to request
that the receiver acknowledges the message.  The term 'mixed' comes
from the AMQP 1.0 standard.

Change-Id: Ida4e04f0827fff902d692f13ec972b099703adf0
"}]
commit_message:
Set the default link property to allow message acks

Previously the default snd-settle-mode caused the sender to assume the
message would not be acknowledged so the sender never waited for an
acknowledgement.  The 'mixed' setting allows the sender to request
that the receiver acknowledges the message.  The term 'mixed' comes
from the AMQP 1.0 standard.

Change-Id: Ida4e04f0827fff902d692f13ec972b099703adf0

commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: I9fa4fc5e24dafc8e1dcbb2c642994bda2628ded5

change will be first.
It also update recent configuration change to allow
resize pci to work on the compute nodes

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-01 03:00:44.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/install-guide-revised-draft/figures/arch-layout-test.svg', 'doc/source/install-guide-revised-draft/figures/arch-layout.graffle', 'doc/source/install-guide-revised-draft/figures/arch-layout-test.png', 'doc/source/install-guide-revised-draft/figures/arch-layout-production.svg', 'doc/source/install-guide-revised-draft/figures/arch-layout-production.png'], 'message': '[docs] Modify host layout diagrams

Refine host layout diagrams:
1. Test environment - s/logging agent/rsyslog bind;
s/log aggregation host/rsyslog server; move load balancers to the
control plane host; Move repos to the control plane host
2. Production environment - Remove logstash, kibana, and logging agent;
s/log aggregation host/rsyslog server; remove Ceph; change block storage
management to a solid line; s/block storage host/Network-connected
storage

Change-Id: Id0206e3a3e7c511bebce74b24d80e730f4be56b4
Implements: blueprint osa-install-guide-overhaul
'}]
commit_message:
[docs] Modify host layout diagrams

Refine host layout diagrams:
1. Test environment - s/logging agent/rsyslog bind;
s/log aggregation host/rsyslog server; move load balancers to the
control plane host; Move repos to the control plane host
2. Production environment - Remove logstash, kibana, and logging agent;
s/log aggregation host/rsyslog server; remove Ceph; change block storage
management to a solid line; s/block storage host/Network-connected
storage

Change-Id: Id0206e3a3e7c511bebce74b24d80e730f4be56b4
Implements: blueprint osa-install-guide-overhaul

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-07-26 16:37:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/security_group/neutron_driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_neutron_security_groups.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py'], 'message': "Enable deferred IP on Neutron ports

When booting a VM using an existing port, Nova checks that the port
has fixed ips and fails if it doesn't. In the context of Neutron
routed networks, a port may not have an IP address because address
allocation was deferred. Neutron can communicate that this is ok
through the ip_allocation attribute of the port added in the patch on
which this one depends.

In the absence of the ip_allocation attribute, Nova falls back to its
previous behavior.

Change-Id: I03f2e02377a743f4dd10ca12e6c31bb71ee36767
Depends-On: I591d32df512712e4de36fe20e389b3a14d58157f
Depends-On: I8dc8890907d1e241dd12448fa184cea1b0620663
Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-routed-networks
"}]
commit_message:
Enable deferred IP on Neutron ports

When booting a VM using an existing port, Nova checks that the port
has fixed ips and fails if it doesn't. In the context of Neutron
routed networks, a port may not have an IP address because address
allocation was deferred. Neutron can communicate that this is ok
through the ip_allocation attribute of the port added in the patch on
which this one depends.

In the absence of the ip_allocation attribute, Nova falls back to its
previous behavior.

Change-Id: I03f2e02377a743f4dd10ca12e6c31bb71ee36767
Depends-On: I591d32df512712e4de36fe20e389b3a14d58157f
Depends-On: I8dc8890907d1e241dd12448fa184cea1b0620663
Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-routed-networks

commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: I16a81da2b61cd69bafc59ac113fe546a748e8675

commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: Ie13187a41fd91390c16ab9ef39c1c1153522802a

subject: Add --yes flags to heat stack-delete for liberty
revisions:

My tests are failing because they are waiting for a manual
confirmation on heat stack-delete:

 heat stack-delete tenant-stack
Are you sure you want to delete this stack(s) [y/N]?

heat-manage shows we are on liberty: heat-manage --version
5.0.1

So first check if the --yes flag is available under that

Change-Id: I2b5b69715879a195f34785d995f1a4aed0c49ab3

commit_message:
Add --yes flags to heat stack-delete for liberty

My tests are failing because they are waiting for a manual
confirmation on heat stack-delete:

 heat stack-delete tenant-stack
Are you sure you want to delete this stack(s) [y/N]?

heat-manage shows we are on liberty: heat-manage --version
5.0.1

So first check if the --yes flag is available under that
liberty deployment. If it is, add the --yes flag, if not
present continue without confirmation.

Change-Id: I2b5b69715879a195f34785d995f1a4aed0c49ab3

revisions:

They are in fact Tempest-based tests. Moving them under sahara_tempest_plugin
- removes the need of an additional entry point, which would be complicated
  if not impossibile to handle;
- allows tests to be run like other Tempest tests;
- allows us to share code (like generic templates when certain plugins are
  enabled).

The handling of test initializations does not rely on pre- or post- scripts
as before:
- image upload is handled by devstack (URL specified in the pre- script);
- the special flavor is created on demand by the test which requires it.

There are also few code fixes.

TODO: remove hardcoded values in favor of tempest configuration (image name
and user, plugin options).

Change-Id: Ibcc30c81f94e300001ffa409635cba5c5677cb19
'}]
commit_message:
Move CLI tests under sahara_tempest_plugin

They are in fact Tempest-based tests. Moving them under sahara_tempest_plugin
- removes the need of an additional entry point, which would be complicated
  if not impossibile to handle;
- allows tests to be run like other Tempest tests;
- allows us to share code (like generic templates when certain plugins are
  enabled).

The handling of test initializations does not rely on pre- or post- scripts
as before:
- image upload is handled by devstack (URL specified in the pre- script);
- the special flavor is created on demand by the test which requires it.

There are also few code fixes.

TODO: remove hardcoded values in favor of tempest configuration (image name
and user, plugin options).

Change-Id: Ibcc30c81f94e300001ffa409635cba5c5677cb19

commit_message:
Add SNI support via OS packages

To ensure that the OS for the deployment host is appropriately
prepared to install Ansible, to install pip, OS packages are
installed.

Fedora install support is removed from the script as it is an
unsupported platform and unmaintained section.

This is a combined, but selective backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/346353
- https://review.openstack.org/348860
- https://review.openstack.org/348970

The backport ensures accurate OS detection and appropriate
package installation for Ansible outside of a python venv.

Change-Id: Ib4e219294f5fd93c6a50814955ab97424a79dafd
(cherry picked from commit 9c659fb54be5fe737d9372a7f7a115c5bcd1145d)

Default is public."
If you create an image without specifying visibility parameter,
you will get an image with "private" visibility value. That's

Closes-Bug: #1605743

commit_message:
Fixed the default visibility value for image creation

The docs describes the visibility parameter in such way
"Image visibility. Valid value is public or private.
Default is public."
If you create an image without specifying visibility parameter,
you will get an image with "private" visibility value. That's
incorrect. This fix resolves the bug.

Change-Id: I6fa77d950b872d025fcc6faf535a9ef97c6d3a6f
Closes-Bug: #1605743

commit_message:
Disable cloud-init services after provisioning

cloud-init services should be disabled after provisioning, otherwise they will
try to get configuration on each reboot and increase booting time to ~2 minutes

Change-Id: I3a0d811b0cee007d23a2bc85c62fa6b2bb54b45f
Closes-bug: #1553733
(cherry picked from commit afadfa9ee1f3e1a7fbd23b6c5b7fd8383c21d769)

commit_message:
Require oslo.rootwrap>=5.0.0

rootwrap 5.0.0 provides the ability to run privsep without additional
config, which is needed to seamlessly rolling forward on privsep
enabled os-brick, os-vif, nova, neutron, cinder.

We bump upper-constraints and raise the minimum required version in
g-r to make grenade work. Without bumping the minimumm, the version of
rootwrap from mitaka satisfies master and we don't get the fix on
upgrade (to use privsep-helper).

It also unpins os-brick 1.4.0, which was blocked only because of the
use of privsep and no upgrade path.

Nova change
Depends-On: I3a52f762deb176fe9201b2a0f0da363057f8aaec

Cinder chage
Depends-On: Id9652ccf001a707fbd59e277c36817bd6d58e7b3

Change-Id: Ic2fc55fd33e35f26a06f8655224af12b705dca4e

commit_message:
Move data-driven-upgrade test imports from run_tests.py

Old-way test import produces merge conflict each time when new test
is added for suite and cherry-picked from mitaka to 8.0 branch.
Moving imports out of run_tests.py removes this behaviour.

Test discovering mechanism used in mitaka and master branch ignores
imports in __init__ file.

Change-Id: Ic822afc1f4ef8d65800fed379b0840320566c398

commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: I9cd74e8267e3dc13be143586699b7f88ed099d49

Revert "Using novaclient according to LP#1493576"

This reverts commit b9e2b338b775d070a204d3546ebeb397a72703f0.

Tests fail with: "TypeError: Client() takes at least 1 argument (4 given)". We need to backport e48d37a5187dd7d58b50b323593162360119d450 to properly fix the issue with deprecated API usage.

Change-Id: I8554fd0afa5664a2fe6443d7c6b0e26e0cb170e7

subject: Capture DatabaseError for deadlock check
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-02 10:40:13.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/sqlalchemy/exc_filters.py', 'oslo_db/tests/sqlalchemy/test_exc_filters.py'], 'message': "Capture DatabaseError for deadlock check

Pymysql can raise 'lock wait timeout exceeded' errors
as InternalErrors. The previous filter was only catching
OperationalError exceptions. This patch changes it to
catch all DatabaseErrors, which both of the aforementioned
exceptions inherit.

Change-Id: If7bd1ceef6e5d64f0766b780616388c62862ce82
Closes-Bug: #1608691
"}]
commit_message:
Capture DatabaseError for deadlock check

Pymysql can raise 'lock wait timeout exceeded' errors
as InternalErrors. The previous filter was only catching
OperationalError exceptions. This patch changes it to
catch all DatabaseErrors, which both of the aforementioned
exceptions inherit.

Change-Id: If7bd1ceef6e5d64f0766b780616388c62862ce82
Closes-Bug: #1608691

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 10:27:02.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_rabbit_utils.py', 'hooks/rabbit_utils.py'], 'message': 'Do not wait eternally for rabbitmqctl wait

rabbitmqctl wait $PIDFILE would wait for eternity even if rabbitmq
fails to come up. Set a reasonable timeout of 3 minutes. If the
timeout is reached set status appropriately and throw an exception.

Change-Id: I6b872a6601a7a4e65ed60a52d0bed0ab67b3d5d6
'}]
commit_message:
Do not wait eternally for rabbitmqctl wait

rabbitmqctl wait $PIDFILE would wait for eternity even if rabbitmq
fails to come up. Set a reasonable timeout of 3 minutes. If the
timeout is reached set status appropriately and throw an exception.

Change-Id: I6b872a6601a7a4e65ed60a52d0bed0ab67b3d5d6

commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: Icb17a955192307be9502f7904135ec39ff59984a

commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

This patch also remove duplicated apt install tasks and the is_metal
variable which is not used anywhere.

Change-Id: I0368cb090b37bf92b0ffce3cee8d7f4c4f61135b

commit_message:
Use keystone library for heat_stack_domain_admin

The keystone library has been updated to support adding a user to a
domain and assigning a role without specifying a project.
Use it instead of shelling out to the openstackclient.

Closes-Bug: 1579612
Depends-On: I6a132e5407c9881a047037b85bd6e25b85c0d8a1
Change-Id: I2659f0496528c29e036c459494a463182e69599d
(cherry picked from commit b45b74eb4f3fe4f4dd7539ad99fcde4d383ffd72)

OVN has added a new DHC_Options table in OVN NB DB to define
DHCP options. Logical Switch ports refer to this table if
DHCP is to be enabled.

This patch creates rows for DHCP_Options for each of the
subnets and adds the reference to the ports when created.

If extra DHCP options are defined for a port, a new
DHCP_Options row is created for the port.

Change-Id: Ia3e229f86bf66f5b9b0d867ff41f56ed4be2e8f4
Closes-bug: #1514488
'}]
commit_message:
Support native OVN DHCPv4

OVN has added a new DHC_Options table in OVN NB DB to define
DHCP options. Logical Switch ports refer to this table if
DHCP is to be enabled.

This patch creates rows for DHCP_Options for each of the
subnets and adds the reference to the ports when created.

If extra DHCP options are defined for a port, a new
DHCP_Options row is created for the port.

Change-Id: Ia3e229f86bf66f5b9b0d867ff41f56ed4be2e8f4
Closes-bug: #1514488

commit_message:
Add tenant_id parameter to limits.

Cinder API allows specifying tenant_id to get tenant
specific resource usage. This was missing in the client.
This fix should allow fetching tenant specific resource usage
directly from the client. Added tenant argument to the limits CLI.

Closes-Bug: #1580562
Change-Id: I3fbd6341f6d018a79e7c343107ac974b6fbb9239

commit_message:
Add support for 'jewel' ceph on Xenial

1. Replace ceph-all service check

  jewel in xenial doesn't provide ceph-all meta-service,
  this commit replaces it with checks of particular services.

2. Update another ceph-related service management command.

blueprint: mos-xenial

Change-Id: I8fcc1e763c2da984fad96cc58ebcd72d5de53ee3

subject: Add ability to change apt/yum package state
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-02 12:29:36.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/install-apt.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/package-state-ed22b9a6683690b3.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: Ibdec442314f2a3d0b175caef2696cddc96d4c9ed
'}]
commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: Ibdec442314f2a3d0b175caef2696cddc96d4c9ed

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts

Many places, there are more specific asserts which can be used.
I replaced the generic assert with more specific ones, where
it was possible.

This change enhances readibility, and on fail, more useful
message is displayed

Change-Id: I86a6baeae2cd36610a2be10ae5085555246c368a

Change-Id: Iffdca41860b1b800aab21bc71bf4598558494f73

commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: Iffdca41860b1b800aab21bc71bf4598558494f73

subject: Resync charm helpers for PG calc fixes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 10:01:20.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/storage/linux/ceph.py', 'tests/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/amulet/utils.py', 'hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/charmsupport/nrpe.py', 'hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/amulet/utils.py'], 'message': 'Resync charm helpers for PG calc fixes

When the Ceph RADOS Gateway is used with small OSD configurations
(3 OSDs), the light pools consume 0.1% of storage by default; this
results in PG counts below or equal to 0; enforce a minimum PG count
of 2 as specified in the official Ceph PG calculator.

Change-Id: I33df3ade8ce85f1928f44d402b8a2f445c479efb
Closes-Bug: 1607961
'}]
commit_message:
Resync charm helpers for PG calc fixes

When the Ceph RADOS Gateway is used with small OSD configurations
(3 OSDs), the light pools consume 0.1% of storage by default; this
results in PG counts below or equal to 0; enforce a minimum PG count
of 2 as specified in the official Ceph PG calculator.

Change-Id: I33df3ade8ce85f1928f44d402b8a2f445c479efb
Closes-Bug: 1607961

commit_message:
Network resolving in Manila when only subnet passed

We have no need in neutron network if
we get neutron subnet, because there is a method
to find network by its subnet in neutron.
Also added check whether the provided subnet belongs
to provided network.

Change-Id: I25ee14a5132448f0c6a46699222fbc374afb04e8

subject: Add ability to change apt/yum package state
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 12:15:57.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/aodh_install_apt.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/package-state-b032231a3cc99ee0.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: I46876dbbf9000848328d198e5dfa637e822db433
'}]
commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: I46876dbbf9000848328d198e5dfa637e822db433

commit_message:
Ensure corosync files & packages

In Ubuntu 16.04 corosync package is
splitted. "fuel-rabbit-fence" package
needs "notifyd"-part, so depends are
updated.

* ensure corosync necessary directories
* don't run sed on Ubuntu 16.04

blueprint: mos-xenial

Closes-bug: #1587075

Change-Id: I241a7976ad0c347167938a3b2656f633bc988046

With Ansible 2.x the mode parameter must lead with a zero. When
a number is not quoted it may be read as an integer instead of a
string, thus losing the leading zero.

This patch ensures that the mode parameter is explicitly quoted.

The task names are also adjusted to remove the unnecessary mention
of 'nova' in the task. This is simply a cosmetic normalisation.

Change-Id: I30d5230b0bc2d6c392183669937a9009867d8eae
