commit_message:
Ensure that mode is a string

With Ansible 2.x the mode parameter must lead with a zero. When
a number is not quoted it may be read as an integer instead of a
string, thus losing the leading zero.

This patch ensures that the mode parameter is explicitly quoted.

The task names are also adjusted to remove the unnecessary mention
of 'nova' in the task. This is simply a cosmetic normalisation.

The tags which were recently added are also removed as they do not
conform to the agreed tag standard set.

Change-Id: I30d5230b0bc2d6c392183669937a9009867d8eae

rest_client started taking new param 'http_timeout' for

Below patch added 'http_timeout' in 'default_params' returned from
tempest->config.py and zaqar service clients broke as they do not accept
any new kwargs.
- Ic035fdb93734c926b26b33feb610e0977e48c646

This patch makes zaqar service clients to accept and pass **kwargs

Change-Id: I37a0106a08bcf7b30437323fbe4a427d852831ef
"}]
commit_message:
Start accepting **kwargs in service clients

rest_client started taking new param 'http_timeout' for
timeout value but zaqar service clients pass defined set of
kwrags instead of allow all **kwargs.

Below patch added 'http_timeout' in 'default_params' returned from
tempest->config.py and zaqar service clients broke as they do not accept
any new kwargs.
- Ic035fdb93734c926b26b33feb610e0977e48c646

This patch makes zaqar service clients to accept and pass **kwargs
to rest_client.

This fix the current gate failure.

Change-Id: I37a0106a08bcf7b30437323fbe4a427d852831ef

subject: Fix ansible performance issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 08:13:52.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/ironic_init_systemd.yml'], 'message': 'Fix ansible performance issue

When a task is included, contains variables within the
include, and loads other tasks with conditionals that
iterate  (using a lookup plugin) Ansible will spinlock for
~30 seconds per item per task. To resolve this the iteration
using the lookup plugin was removed and the task broken out
into individual tasks.

Change-Id: I2f979c950217f85340fbb22a8c9151b5605753f7
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ansible performance issue

When a task is included, contains variables within the
include, and loads other tasks with conditionals that
iterate  (using a lookup plugin) Ansible will spinlock for
~30 seconds per item per task. To resolve this the iteration
using the lookup plugin was removed and the task broken out
into individual tasks.

Change-Id: I2f979c950217f85340fbb22a8c9151b5605753f7

commit_message:
Ensure that mode is a string

With Ansible 2.x the mode parameter must lead with a zero. When
a number is not quoted it may be read as an integer instead of a
string, thus losing the leading zero.

This patch ensures that the mode parameter is explicitly quoted.

The task names are also adjusted to remove the unnecessary mention
of 'aodh' in the task. This is simply a cosmetic normalisation.

The tags which were recently added are also removed as they do not
conform to the agreed tag standard set.

Change-Id: I2f7fbe2e03a2828f3e892ca30a800c431154be5b

commit_message:
Fix ansible performance issue

When a task is "included", contains variables within the
"include", and loads other tasks with conditionals that
iterate  (using a lookup plugin) Ansible will spinlock for

commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: Ifefa11da81b59084c238a8264fec9f0018dfe23d

Replaced with non-deprecated LOG.warning.

commit_message:
Allow to extends the evaluator lookback window

Sometimes alarm state is flapping we just missing the last datapoint
often. This can be solved by increase dedicated to the metric injection
chain or for less critical scenario, we could allow a bigger lookback window.

This change allows to extends the lookback window with the new
configuration option 'acceptable_ingestion_lag'.

Change-Id: If2aca73aea95c0c6d08afa5fbb89b949099507db
Closes-bug: #1540298
Closes-bug: #1506911

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-16 09:02:29.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkittyclient/client.py'], 'message': 'Fix client V3 unscope bug

Client V3 will get unscope auth as no project provided. Unscope auth

This backport from ceilometer-client patch[1] and I verified it in my
devstack.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/169409/

commit_message:
Fix client V3 unscope bug

Client V3 will get unscope auth as no project provided. Unscope auth
will make client get empty catalog back from keystone.

This backport from ceilometer-client patch[1] and I verified it in my
devstack.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/169409/

Change-Id: I1fa5a5b1e9a40501dfbd563bf608d41eb4879bf8
Closes-Bug: #1522728

subject: Fix empty values validation in nova server
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-06 11:40:12.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/nova/test_server.py'], 'message': "Fix empty values validation in nova server

In some places in validation code we assume '' value as
undefined. Howewer, '' means that property is assigned, but
not yet resolved, i.e. get_attr or get_resource function is
used and resolved to None and next in the code, when we get the value
of specific property, we convert None to default value. In this case
to empty string.

Closes-Bug: #1591098

Change-Id: I03a609ce87944c8efc9ec76a7a314d2de27d16d7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix empty values validation in nova server

In some places in validation code we assume '' value as
undefined. Howewer, '' means that property is assigned, but
not yet resolved, i.e. get_attr or get_resource function is
used and resolved to None and next in the code, when we get the value
of specific property, we convert None to default value. In this case
to empty string.

Closes-Bug: #1591098

Change-Id: I03a609ce87944c8efc9ec76a7a314d2de27d16d7

commit_message:
Always use upper-constraints

This patch modify tox.ini to always use upper-constraints.

Change-Id: I113dd658afebe843db304be6cbc4b1ec5df5d248

commit_message:
Don't raise error when filtering on custom metadata

Hosts can have custom metadata. There is no restriction on the key names
used in this metadata, so we should not be raising an exception when
checking for the existence of any metadata key.

Originally worked on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/271401

Co-Authored-By: Xiaowei Qian <xiaowei.qian@easystack.cn>

Closes-Bug: #1537062

Change-Id: Ie5ff3c1847e9c4533822a77d443e4ce1fcf047fe

commit_message:
Add 'fuel2 env remove nodes' command

Release new 'env remove nodes' command in fuel2
to support remove nodes procedure from specific
environment (cluster):

  fuel2 env remove nodes [-h] -e ENV
            (-n NODES [NODES ...] | --nodes-all)

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1603440

Change-Id: Ibc14966996ae046307299348f62f758980d31ace

revisions:

Lbaasv2 is used by default, we should change service_plugins for lbaas
from 'lbaas' to
'neutron_lbaas.services.loadbalancer.plugin.LoadBalancerPluginv2'
as suggested in networking-guide:
http://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/networking-guide/adv-config-lbaas.html#configuring-lbaas-v2-with-an-agent

Closes-bug: #1608344

commit_message:
Change config for lbaas service_plugins

Lbaasv2 is used by default, we should change service_plugins for lbaas
from 'lbaas' to
'neutron_lbaas.services.loadbalancer.plugin.LoadBalancerPluginv2'
as suggested in networking-guide:
http://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/networking-guide/adv-config-lbaas.html#configuring-lbaas-v2-with-an-agent

Change-Id: I49a24500403bd2717fcad49742830c6ceaaf210b
Closes-bug: #1608344

commit_message:
Remove fastcgi and related configuration

In I62321a7b62dabca469eb072ddbf4e8f250ce0fb3, git daemon was added to
support hosting git repos from the repo server over the git protocol.
When the integrated build transitions to using it, fastcgi and all
related configuration can be removed.

Depends-On: I09bc504490d4b5114895f7f646fc8254748a7f41
Change-Id: I7ec8277d3883d1f8891de6ae2b0881fe026a34c8

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-02 05:06:43.000000000', 'files': ['ansible_tools/playbooks/swift_storage_mount_drives.yml', 'doc/source/swift_storage_mount_drives.rst'], 'message': 'Playbook to mount drives in swift object nodes

Currently in any of the release of openstack-ansible
there is no role to mount the drives in swift object
server nodes. This can now be a part of
openstack-ansible-ops as this is all operational stuff.

If the user knows the type of the file system that is
going to be used, we can mount the drives as well using
the playbook without manual intervention.

Doc is also modified according to the playbook.

Modified the lines according to the comments given.

Change-Id: I991ee4891253d2f99703c80e350df21c43db01e8
Closes-Bug: #1535536
'}]
commit_message:
Playbook to mount drives in swift object nodes

Currently in any of the release of openstack-ansible
there is no role to mount the drives in swift object
server nodes. This can now be a part of
openstack-ansible-ops as this is all operational stuff.

If the user knows the type of the file system that is
going to be used, we can mount the drives as well using
the playbook without manual intervention.

Doc is also modified according to the playbook.

Modified the lines according to the comments given.

Change-Id: I991ee4891253d2f99703c80e350df21c43db01e8
Closes-Bug: #1535536

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-08-02 08:46:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_rpcapi.py', 'nova/compute/rpcapi.py'], 'message': "Don't cache RPC pin when service_version is 0

Its possible for RPC calls to be made before a nova-compute process
starts up. When this happens we cache the RPC pin of kilo. This causes
breakages in live-migrate, but in Mitaka we only work with Liberty.

Change-Id: I5f1e0904c34c4fe26fc75998441602925d2f0593
Closes-Bug: #1598860
"}]
commit_message:
Don't cache RPC pin when service_version is 0

Its possible for RPC calls to be made before a nova-compute process
starts up. When this happens we cache the RPC pin of kilo. This causes
breakages in live-migrate, but in Mitaka we only work with Liberty.

Change-Id: I5f1e0904c34c4fe26fc75998441602925d2f0593
Closes-Bug: #1598860

commit_message:
Correcting form_invalid get_context_data call

not calling the correct instance of get_context_data.

subject: Remove unnecessary checks
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-12 11:46:07.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/api/openstack_v1/test_stacks.py', 'heat/tests/api/cfn/test_api_cfn_v1.py', 'heat/api/cfn/v1/stacks.py', 'heat/api/openstack/v1/stacks.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': "Remove unnecessary checks

Service's _get_stack method already checks
whether the stack is None and if it is, throws
an exception. So methods that use _get_stack
do not need to check the same thing.
Also, looks like there is no way that stack's
self.raw_template.template or self.raw_template.template
can be None or blank, so removed such checks as well
with corresponding tests.

Change-Id: I83d6e9251e0f7b6cacb0ddcfe1a3bc5dcf57d1c3
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary checks

Service's _get_stack method already checks
whether the stack is None and if it is, throws
an exception. So methods that use _get_stack
do not need to check the same thing.
Also, looks like there is no way that stack's
self.raw_template.template or self.raw_template.template
can be None or blank, so removed such checks as well
with corresponding tests.

Change-Id: I83d6e9251e0f7b6cacb0ddcfe1a3bc5dcf57d1c3

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 07:46:28.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/service/api/v11.py'], 'message': "Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should call 'raise'
without any arguments because it shows the place where an exception
occured initially instead of place where the exception re-raised.

Change-Id: I4c0dd68a00be1cc8b33f0e886678fdc14d13dc21
"}]
commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should call 'raise'
without any arguments because it shows the place where an exception
occured initially instead of place where the exception re-raised.

Change-Id: I4c0dd68a00be1cc8b33f0e886678fdc14d13dc21

commit_message:
consumes error notif. when event are disabled

When we fixes #1364708, this was worked only when store_event=True.

This change fixes the issue when store_event=False.

Change-Id: I6748397718be03e3f93ae2ccaa99642decdd9745
Related-bug: #1364708
(cherry picked from commit a3eb0fafadcdcbb8f48f3db13ffc103717bae99b)

for operators and (to a lesser extent) developers.

commit_message:
Fix str_split function when string is None

Currently str_split raises error, when function take string to split as
NoneType object (e.g. get_attr value during validation). Fix such
behaviour to allow resources with str_split in properties pass
validation.

Change-Id: Iabd8ebb90a38253434e7c29005654c9a6abb3196
Closes-bug: #1608482

commit_message:
Allow stack create operations to be cancelled

We want to be able to use the internal API to gracefully cancel a create
operation that is in progress. (Users can still use the stack-cancel-update
command only to cancel an update, not the initial creation of a stack.)

Change-Id: I204f13d9ed7b826c6c5ac94126e23f2ed6d7e97f
Related-Bug: #1591341

subject: Implement Xenial/CentOS jobs for OpenStack-Ansible
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-02 11:09:33.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/openstack-ansible-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Implement Xenial/CentOS jobs for OpenStack-Ansible

OpenStack-Ansible is targeting Ubuntu Xenial and CentOS support
for Newton. As such this patch intends to implement experimental
jobs for these two distributions for initial testing purposes.

The patch does the following:
 - Revises the OpenStack-Ansible job-template to be usable for
   more than one node type and to be able to execute voting
   and non-voting checks.
 - Uses the shell builder (instead of the 'ansible-check-commit'
   builder macro to execute the in-repo script which executes
   the gate check in the same way that a deployer would execute
   a production environment deployment.
 - Removes the 'ansible-check-commit' builder macro as it is no
   longer needed.
 - Implements the ability to execute experimental pipeline jobs
   for Ubuntu Xenial and CentOS-7.

Change-Id: I6dd2c0f5687d843d7273583d51d81acf47fb7ba4
"}]
commit_message:
Implement Xenial/CentOS jobs for OpenStack-Ansible

OpenStack-Ansible is targeting Ubuntu Xenial and CentOS support
for Newton. As such this patch intends to implement experimental
jobs for these two distributions for initial testing purposes.

The patch does the following:
 - Revises the OpenStack-Ansible job-template to be usable for
   more than one node type and to be able to execute voting
   and non-voting checks.
 - Uses the shell builder (instead of the 'ansible-check-commit'
   builder macro to execute the in-repo script which executes
   the gate check in the same way that a deployer would execute
   a production environment deployment.
 - Removes the 'ansible-check-commit' builder macro as it is no
   longer needed.
 - Implements the ability to execute experimental pipeline jobs
   for Ubuntu Xenial and CentOS-7.

Change-Id: I6dd2c0f5687d843d7273583d51d81acf47fb7ba4

Currently sahara EDP job only shows the "Failed" and "Successful"
result for the users, but the users want to know more.They want
to see the detail running information of the EDP job, or they want
to debug the failed job. We should support these functions.

Change-Id: I1eb3fd19f1b722a6743dfb79974ec475d310605a

commit_message:
[spec] EDP log enhancement

Currently sahara EDP job only shows the "Failed" and "Successful"
result for the users, but the users want to know more.They want
to see the detail running information of the EDP job, or they want
to debug the failed job. We should support these functions.

Change-Id: I1eb3fd19f1b722a6743dfb79974ec475d310605a

commit_message:
Fix mappings update for the api using aliases.

This patch should allow freezer to update the mappings in a cleaner way,
now the index works behind an alias that just point to the newest mappings.

This allows to do migrations in the backend without downtime.

Closes-bug: 1604055
Change-Id: I9e5a76dd7374104344dd6934a2e9c2ea540431f7

revisions:

There is a hole in the policy service caching layer
that has something to do with ng-repeat. The angular
http cache service doesn't seem to work within a single
digest cycle or something... so I simplfied and
improved performance by using memoize to
prevent redundant checks which were happening in
hz-dynamic-table.

See bug for details on verifying this manually.

Change-Id: Ib0b3a806d1c6b065e20cb22b8255048bd836dd1b
Closes-Bug: 1608623
"}]
commit_message:
Memoize policy service

There is a hole in the policy service caching layer
that has something to do with ng-repeat. The angular
http cache service doesn't seem to work within a single
digest cycle or something... so I simplfied and
improved performance by using memoize to
prevent redundant checks which were happening in
hz-dynamic-table.

See bug for details on verifying this manually.

Change-Id: Ib0b3a806d1c6b065e20cb22b8255048bd836dd1b
Closes-Bug: 1608623

This patch works around StorletGatewayDocker.invocation_flow and

To assert *REAL* behavior, this patch adds a few unittests to run in

communication of docker container (basically wrap up the response from

This could be the first step to emurate real environment in *UNIT TEST*

Change-Id: I5fbd7cd415053b7913310973f71ad5a7ab48faa0

commit_message:
Add unittests and cleanup codes

This patch works around StorletGatewayDocker.invocation_flow and
RnTimePaths.

To assert *REAL* behavior, this patch adds a few unittests to run in
real os dir. This patch also add an unit test to assert the
communication of docker container (basically wrap up the response from
the container with mock) and check the real handling.

This could be the first step to emurate real environment in *UNIT TEST*
rather than functional tests for easy reproducing and finding real bugs.

In the future work, we could add a temporary server process communicating
with DockerGateway instance via fds.

Change-Id: I5fbd7cd415053b7913310973f71ad5a7ab48faa0

subject: Set encoding to streams
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-06-05 08:02:53.000000000', 'files': ['cliff/app.py', 'cliff/tests/test_app.py'], 'message': 'Set encoding to streams

If fileobject has no encoding set and unicode string is written to the
file object then non-ascii characters cause troubles and app crashes with
UnicodeEncodeError exception. This patch wraps fileobject with encoding
set according environment and if not set, implicit utf-8 is used.

Change-Id: Id439bca3243e0c394d9592ec6c071cb696e64df0
Closes-Bug: 1451936
'}]
commit_message:
Set encoding to streams

If fileobject has no encoding set and unicode string is written to the
file object then non-ascii characters cause troubles and app crashes with
UnicodeEncodeError exception. This patch wraps fileobject with encoding
set according environment and if not set, implicit utf-8 is used.

Change-Id: Id439bca3243e0c394d9592ec6c071cb696e64df0
Closes-Bug: 1451936

commit_message:
fix security_groups's rules comparision

Neutron recently added 'revision' key to security group rule's output
but incoming rule doesn't contain (and doesn't care about) such key.
patchset adds this key to exclude's list.

Change-Id: I89350e40834dae118acc4cfafe3c6e09e36737c2

commit_message:
Add missing db class to configure glance-manage.conf

Based on the TripleO new NG HA architecture, we need to
configure the following parameters in puppet-glance by
creating the db class:

  glance::db::database_db_max_retries: -1
  glance::db::database_max_retries: -1

Closes-Bug: #1608548

Change-Id: Ib88105cafc7937d9614e4a8615e974adf6592458

commit_message:
Fix encoding problem on json dump

This problem may happen if in sending msg there are unicode symbols
Defautlt encoding is ASCII-8BIT so for fixing this error required to
encode sending msg to UTF-8 before making json dump.

Change-Id: Id6ed9bacac0ea4aa6d8901e056b66621e997d7e0
Related-bug: 1594381

commit_message:
show ptl details in list-changes output

Part of verifying that a release is OK is ensuring that the liaison or
PTL has signed off. This patch adds information about the PTL to the
list-changes output for easy reference.

Change-Id: I1d88271d2b4a46280b13574c6e1682d8df5700bb
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: verify that new entries are being appended
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-13 12:48:51.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/cmds/validate.py'], 'message': 'verify that new entries are being appended

Because of the way we generate the list of new versions to be tagged in
the tagging scripts, we need to ensure that all new entries are being
appended to the deliverable files. Add a validation step for that check
instead of relying on human reviewers.

Change-Id: Ieaf9065f364d4e8228ba2cc1ad8e038bcfbcb93a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
verify that new entries are being appended

Because of the way we generate the list of new versions to be tagged in
the tagging scripts, we need to ensure that all new entries are being
appended to the deliverable files. Add a validation step for that check
instead of relying on human reviewers.

Change-Id: Ieaf9065f364d4e8228ba2cc1ad8e038bcfbcb93a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Delete snaphots on deleting stack

Currently if convergence is enabled then deleting stack does not
deletes the snapshots. This patch deletes the snapshots before
deleting the stack.

Co-Authored-By: Rakesh H S <rh-s@hpe.com>

Change-Id: I1cb321a3878a0abce9b41832f76bf77c25bf7cb4
Closes-Bug: #1508299

commit_message:
Switch using network_device_mtu to global_physnet_mtu

Parameter network_device_mtu has been deprecated in Mitaka cycle
and now will be removed from puppet-neutron, hence we need to
remove it from library too.

Change-Id: I4092a2f75691a0030f7ca4d18da3bfd7aeac1adc
Closes-bug: #1608438

commit_message:
Add 'fuel2 release component list' command

In Nailgun there is an API call for getting JSON data
of compatible components for release and all plugins
releated with it (GET /api/v1/releases/<:id>/components/).
This patch adds new fuel2 command, e.g.:

       fuel2 release component list 1

This command prints list of components for given Fuel release
with respective cross-dependencies

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1600501

Change-Id: I055d6fb4dde4cb0ac9508084155bbce5a106220c

commit_message:
backward compatibility for text_list

In 9.0 release text_list attribute value has been changed
and now it's list of strings. The old releases have also
this type of attribute and it's value is generated by
generator from_settings what is incorrect in terms of
9.0 release, because old text_list type should be
comma separated list. Hence migration has been added
to avoid such problems with old releases.

Change-Id: Id5794e5d56698cf6ecbb5445af74495fc9b8059c
Closes-Bug: #1597736

commit_message:
[config-ref] consolidate logging config options into common

Use the logging section in the common configurations chapter.
Change their option flags to "disable" that is implemented
with patch Ied2d03d1c7f71f5712fcf57d4499e127db327b7d.
Also, fix a few incorrect flagmappings.

Change-Id: I9ba931a86e70f843340a9f5366eae6aca5d3ebf2

subject: Correct reraising of exception
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-02 07:27:26.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/horizon/congress.py'], 'message': "Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should call 'raise'
without any arguments because it shows the place where an exception
occured initially instead of place where the exception re-raised.

Change-Id: Idccffe1e35153b8340859128b068c33662af9e36
"}]
commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should call 'raise'
without any arguments because it shows the place where an exception
occured initially instead of place where the exception re-raised.

Change-Id: Idccffe1e35153b8340859128b068c33662af9e36

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-01 21:23:06.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/l2/extensions/test_ovs_agent_qos_extension.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l2/extensions/test_qos.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/api/rpc/handlers/test_resources_rpc.py', 'neutron/api/rpc/handlers/resources_rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/qos/notification_drivers/test_message_queue.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/qos/notification_drivers/test_manager.py', 'neutron/agent/l2/extensions/qos.py', 'doc/source/devref/rpc_callbacks.rst', 'neutron/api/rpc/callbacks/consumer/registry.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/api/rpc/callbacks/consumer/test_registry.py', 'neutron/services/qos/notification_drivers/message_queue.py'], 'message': 'Introduce bulk push to rpc callback mechanism

There are usage patterns which would benefit from having
the capability to send a list of resources in bulk instead
of using individual fanout messages.

From now on, the rpc callback subscriber receives a list of
resources (single or multiple), and the pushers must always
push a list.

Backwards compatibility for QoSPolicy consumers in mitaka
is provided by calling push with "resource" parameter for
single item lists during one release cycle. That will be
dropped when Ocata opens.

Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

Change-Id: I1117925360a29ecbd1902fa527b2f24f94ce81ec
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce bulk push to rpc callback mechanism

There are usage patterns which would benefit from having
the capability to send a list of resources in bulk instead
of using individual fanout messages.

From now on, the rpc callback subscriber receives a list of
resources (single or multiple), and the pushers must always
push a list.

Backwards compatibility for QoSPolicy consumers in mitaka
is provided by calling push with "resource" parameter for
single item lists during one release cycle. That will be
dropped when Ocata opens.

Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

Change-Id: I1117925360a29ecbd1902fa527b2f24f94ce81ec

subject: If /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save exists, move it to nova_libvirt_save_path
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-28 18:04:29.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_compute_kvm_install.yml'], 'message': 'If /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save exists, move it to nova_libvirt_save_path

In https://review.openstack.org/320624 the qemu save directory was set
to be a link into the same directory where nova instances are kept in
order to ensure that temporary files created in snapshots are stored
in a location which is likely on shared storage or has plenty of space.

The patch did not actually create the link if a folder existed there
already, so this patch implements a move of the folder and a link to
replace it.

Closes-Bug: #1585325
Change-Id: I5224ac72b14ad027410f5d5c14d20870dd37b5cb
'}]
commit_message:
If /var/lib/libvirt/qemu/save exists, move it to nova_libvirt_save_path

In https://review.openstack.org/320624 the qemu save directory was set
to be a link into the same directory where nova instances are kept in
order to ensure that temporary files created in snapshots are stored
in a location which is likely on shared storage or has plenty of space.

The patch did not actually create the link if a folder existed there
already, so this patch implements a move of the folder and a link to
replace it.

Closes-Bug: #1585325
Change-Id: I5224ac72b14ad027410f5d5c14d20870dd37b5cb

TLS section

This section covers Transport Layer Security in the bay.  TLS
operation includes Magnum to bay, nodes to masters, and user to
COE API endpoint.  User examples are provided, including the
new bay-config command.

The tls.rst doc is incorporated into the user guide with
revision and update.

Partially implements: blueprint user-guide
Change-Id: Idbd9d9fd16cb4aa7e3cce8845c44eee654ac3dfc

commit_message:
Add TLS section to User Guide

TLS section

This section covers Transport Layer Security in the bay.  TLS
operation includes Magnum to bay, nodes to masters, and user to
COE API endpoint.  User examples are provided, including the
new bay-config command.

The tls.rst doc is incorporated into the user guide with
revision and update.

Partially implements: blueprint user-guide
Change-Id: Idbd9d9fd16cb4aa7e3cce8845c44eee654ac3dfc

commit_message:
Allow a deployer to disable container restarts

This changes allows a deployer to disable a container restart
by setting the option ``lxc_container_allow_restarts`` to ``false``.

Forward port based on:
 - https://review.openstack.org/344834
 - https://review.openstack.org/346064

Change-Id: I2c681d7e0681f8586286dc9f371d7b5e231bda68
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Force fuelmenu to re-read resolv.conf on change

Fuelmenu updates resolv.conf but uses old nameservers till restart.
It makes NTP and repository accessibility checks to fail.

Change-Id: Ifc6f1d51f655b7329af6942bb060beebeeae5fef
Closes-Bug: 1603445

commit_message:
Force fuelmenu to re-read resolv.conf on change

Fuelmenu updates resolv.conf but uses old nameservers till restart.
It makes NTP and repository accessibility checks to fail.

Change-Id: Ifc6f1d51f655b7329af6942bb060beebeeae5fef

commit_message:
volume upload-to-image fails for iso disk-format

upload volume to image fails if disk-format is iso with error
u"qemu-img: Unknown file format 'iso'\n".

Raising HTTP 400 error if disk-format is other than
'raw', 'vmdk', 'vdi', 'qcow2'.

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: #1540938
(cherry picked from commit c5df00798acf0bc99ad8dc73d2707e3053e0cbca)

commit_message:
Add scoring engines to database and API layers

A Scoring Module needs to expose a list of available
scoring engines through API and Watcher CLI. This list
is stored in database and synchronized by Decision Engine.

Partially-Implements: blueprint scoring-module
Change-Id: I32168adeaf34fd12a731204c5b58fe68434ad087
APIImpact

commit_message:
Fix bug in RPC config that broke Rabbit SSL support

The use_rabbit_ssl query parameter is not respected by
oslo.messaging's rabbit driver, only the pika driver
supports configuration using query parameters at present.

Change-Id: Ib3ee5b409dbc2fc2dc8d25990d4962ec49e21131
Implements: blueprint multi-rabbitmq-clusters

commit_message:
Implement goal_id, strategy_id and host_aggregate into Audit api

Modifying the api controller for audit objects to allow
creation of audit objects by specifying either an
audit_template uuid/id and/or a goal_id.

strategy_id is optional.

Partially Implements: blueprint persistent-audit-parameters
Change-Id: I7b3eae4d0752a11208f5f92ee13ab1018d8521ad

subject: Fixed simple performance issue and deprecations
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-02 03:06:38.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/swift_rings_post_distribution_check.yml', 'tasks/swift_rings_build.yml', 'tasks/swift_pypy_setup.yml', 'tasks/swift_init_systemd.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Fixed simple performance issue and deprecations

* Unquoted veriable deprecations have been resolved.
  [DEPRECATION WARNING]: Using bare variables is deprecated.
* Undefined variable references have been ressolved.
  [DEPRECATION WARNING]: Skipping task due to undefined Error,
* An Ansible performance issue has been discovered and fixed.
    When a task is "included", contains variables within the
    "include", and loads other tasks with conditionals that
    iterate  (using a lookup plugin) Ansible will spinlock for
    ~30 seconds per item per task. To resolve this the iteration
    using the lookup plugin was removed and the task broken out
    into individual tasks.

Change-Id: I1ca59bc71b93324900a2e68b9d83d075d8e8ce32
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed simple performance issue and deprecations

* Unquoted veriable deprecations have been resolved.
  [DEPRECATION WARNING]: Using bare variables is deprecated.
* Undefined variable references have been ressolved.
  [DEPRECATION WARNING]: Skipping task due to undefined Error,
* An Ansible performance issue has been discovered and fixed.
    When a task is "included", contains variables within the
    "include", and loads other tasks with conditionals that
    iterate  (using a lookup plugin) Ansible will spinlock for
    ~30 seconds per item per task. To resolve this the iteration
    using the lookup plugin was removed and the task broken out
    into individual tasks.

Change-Id: I1ca59bc71b93324900a2e68b9d83d075d8e8ce32
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: glance: disable swift backend
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-27 19:14:43.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp', 'elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': "glance: disable swift backend

- Disable Swift backend in the list of stores available in Glance.
- Set file backend by default.
- include glance::backend::file

We're having a lot of OOM in swift-proxy-server at this time, this patch
aims to temporarily disable Swift backend for Glance.

We'll reconsider enable it again in the future, but due to limited CI
resources, let's disable it now.

Related-Bug: #1595916
Change-Id: I5e2feff7e5dc900849c9535f2b7ac05d3c8f93e1
"}]
commit_message:
glance: disable swift backend

- Disable Swift backend in the list of stores available in Glance.
- Set file backend by default.
- include glance::backend::file

We're having a lot of OOM in swift-proxy-server at this time, this patch
aims to temporarily disable Swift backend for Glance.

We'll reconsider enable it again in the future, but due to limited CI
resources, let's disable it now.

Related-Bug: #1595916
Change-Id: I5e2feff7e5dc900849c9535f2b7ac05d3c8f93e1

* If a workflow is large then parsing a spec takes significant
  time and it's too expensive to do it often. For example,

commit_message:
Removing unnecessary workflow specification parsing

* If a workflow is large then parsing a spec takes significant
  time and it's too expensive to do it often. For example,
  on a regular laptop parsing a workflow consisting from
  100 tasks takes about 2 seconds. That was the reason why
  such a workflow used to take so much time to start, ~200
  seconds. This patch eliminates unnecessary parsing by
  applying caching for workflow specifications.

Change-Id: Iabfdea2182a81cda07a8692f5b84c6bfb561bb83

subject: Add charm-barbican, and related
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-07-22 09:24:35.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'gerrit/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Add charm-barbican, and related

Add charm for Barbican and a subordinate charm for the SoftHSM2
plugin and an interface for connecting the two charms together.

These charms are designed to use Python 3 for execution, so enable check
and gate targets for Python 3.4 (14.04) and 3.5 (16.04) to ensure
compatibility.

Change-Id: I4a9f46da5555dd7b27ff5610c3c34e3d23896d2b
Needed-By: I725ca81468de3cd81e1be44313aefc5cc1360cd7
'}]
commit_message:
Add charm-barbican, and related

Add charm for Barbican and a subordinate charm for the SoftHSM2
plugin and an interface for connecting the two charms together.

These charms are designed to use Python 3 for execution, so enable check
and gate targets for Python 3.4 (14.04) and 3.5 (16.04) to ensure
compatibility.

Change-Id: I4a9f46da5555dd7b27ff5610c3c34e3d23896d2b
Needed-By: I725ca81468de3cd81e1be44313aefc5cc1360cd7

commit_message:
Add swift job tox-func-in-process-encryption

Adds a non-voting check job for swift to run the
tox func-in-process-encryption env.

Will only run for master and future supported stable branches
(i.e. not run for stable/liberty and stable/mitaka).

Change-Id: Ia81b55513880673be719dc3c1c6abda0cd49e338
Depends-On: I15c4b20f1d2be57ae21c69c614f6a9579145bee9

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-08-01 15:40:16.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix. Do not create port if vnic_type defined and port is passed.

If we are passing a preexisting port during server create
there is no need to create networks or port again.
We need to create a server using preexisting port.

Change-Id: I25266d3641202c3099fd603c57945b718004cfd7
Co-Authored-By: Moshe Levi <moshele@mellanox.com>
Closes-Bug: 1603758
'}]
commit_message:
Fix. Do not create port if vnic_type defined and port is passed.

If we are passing a preexisting port during server create
there is no need to create networks or port again.
We need to create a server using preexisting port.

Change-Id: I25266d3641202c3099fd603c57945b718004cfd7
Co-Authored-By: Moshe Levi <moshele@mellanox.com>
Closes-Bug: 1603758

subject: Serve the aodh-api using mod_wsgi
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-19 13:17:18.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/aodh_post_install.yml', 'templates/aodh-ports.conf.j2', 'tasks/main.yml', 'doc/source/index.rst', 'templates/aodh-httpd.conf.j2', 'tasks/aodh_apache.yml', 'handlers/main.yml', 'templates/aodh-api-wsgi.py.j2', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tasks/aodh_pre_install.yml'], 'message': 'Serve the aodh-api using mod_wsgi

aodh upstream change Iefd6f4d9f76c69ed9b49483e1feda0b7dbe2cb81
moves from Werkzeug to WSGI so we should follow suit

Without this change, the aodh-api service fails to start at all.

Apache vhost config based on https://github.com/openstack/aodh/blob/master/etc/apache2/aodh

Change-Id: I2fb1eb984949a4457ae313cffec872a0bb425eab
'}]
commit_message:
Serve the aodh-api using mod_wsgi

aodh upstream change Iefd6f4d9f76c69ed9b49483e1feda0b7dbe2cb81
moves from Werkzeug to WSGI so we should follow suit

Without this change, the aodh-api service fails to start at all.

Apache vhost config based on https://github.com/openstack/aodh/blob/master/etc/apache2/aodh

Change-Id: I2fb1eb984949a4457ae313cffec872a0bb425eab

subject: Fix ansible performance issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 04:59:32.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/gnocchi_init_systemd.yml'], 'message': 'Fix ansible performance issue

An Ansible performance issue has been found when a task that contains
iterable variables is included in a task that uses a higher level
conditional. This patch breaks the task out into individual tasks
to remove the delay.

Change-Id: I015139175a573e39855dc4cde7e667760941c245
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ansible performance issue

An Ansible performance issue has been found when a task that contains
iterable variables is included in a task that uses a higher level
conditional. This patch breaks the task out into individual tasks
to remove the delay.

Change-Id: I015139175a573e39855dc4cde7e667760941c245

commit_message:
Fix ansible performance issue

An Ansible performance issue has been found when a task that contains
iterable variables is included in a task that uses a higher level
conditional. This patch breaks the task out into individual tasks
to remove the delay.

Change-Id: I7f893df8284ee0eafe4aa7b2a8e9b087b27451cb

commit_message:
Splitting executions into different tables

* Having different types of execution objects in different
  tables will give less contention on DB tables and hence better
  performance so DB schema was changed accordingly
* Fixed all unit tests and places in the code where we assumed
  polymorphic access to execution objects
* Other minor fixes

TODO(in upcoming patches):
* DB migration script

Change-Id: Ibc8408e12dd85e143302d7fdddace32954551ac5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-14 03:47:09.000000000', 'files': ['descriptions/ops-docs-install-guide.rst'], 'message': 'Have docs install guide tag not focus on distros.

With recent developments within the documentation team [1], service
install guides might not provide a distribution specific way for
installation. Instead this will focus on install guides being available
for supported releases, instead of supported distributions.

[1] - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/docs-specs/specs/newton/project-specific-installguides.html

Change-Id: Id28667ec7a65f954eb2a3f3980231fa63d5ff1c0
'}]
commit_message:
Have docs install guide tag not focus on distros.

With recent developments within the documentation team [1], service
install guides might not provide a distribution specific way for
installation. Instead this will focus on install guides being available
for supported releases, instead of supported distributions.

[1] - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/docs-specs/specs/newton/project-specific-installguides.html

Change-Id: Id28667ec7a65f954eb2a3f3980231fa63d5ff1c0

subject: Add SNI support via OS packages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-01 18:06:41.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/scripts-library.sh', 'scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh'], 'message': 'Add SNI support via OS packages

To ensure that the OS for the deployment host is appropriately
prepared to install Ansible, to install pip, OS packages are
installed.

Fedora install support is removed from the script as it is an
unsupported platform and unmaintained section.

This is a combined, but selective backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/346353
- https://review.openstack.org/348860
- https://review.openstack.org/348970

The backport ensures accurate OS detection and appropriate
package installation for Ansible outside of a python venv.

Change-Id: Ib4e219294f5fd93c6a50814955ab97424a79dafd
'}]
commit_message:
Add SNI support via OS packages

To ensure that the OS for the deployment host is appropriately
prepared to install Ansible, to install pip, OS packages are
installed.

Fedora install support is removed from the script as it is an
unsupported platform and unmaintained section.

This is a combined, but selective backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/346353
- https://review.openstack.org/348860
- https://review.openstack.org/348970

The backport ensures accurate OS detection and appropriate
package installation for Ansible outside of a python venv.

Change-Id: Ib4e219294f5fd93c6a50814955ab97424a79dafd

commit_message:
k8s_coreos_driver: cleanup file naming

Since we have seperate template files to different driver directory, we
can cleanup -coreos suffix from template.

1. Remove unused shell scripts.
2. Remove kube-examples.yaml and kube-user.yaml which is never used.

Closes-bug: #1606655
Change-Id: I6ac93ad23e7ae30ad1eb9be1c79c2cf36af8db0c

subject: Improve Javelin CLI UT
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5689, 'name': 'Masayuki Igawa', 'email': 'masayuki@igawa.io', 'username': 'igawa'}, {'_account_id': 7020, 'name': 'Joe Hakim Rahme', 'email': 'jhakimra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rahmu'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12017, 'name': 'DellEMC VNX CI', 'email': 'emc.vnx.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-vnx-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15482, 'name': 'xu chao', 'email': 'xu.chao@99cloud.net', 'username': 'xuchao'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-14 00:48:12.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/cmd/test_javelin.py'], 'message': 'Improve Javelin CLI UT

Now grenade does not use Javelin CLI for upgrade testing, which makes
this CLI untested on gate and there were some maintainability issues of this
CLI.

Till Tempest own this CLI, we should maintain the same.

For any modifications in interfaces used by this CLI, for example on
service clients etc, this CLI needs to be updated accordingly.
But it is always missed due to no failure on gate and it is very hard to
catch the required updates while review.

Unit tests are also not so effective as they mock the OS client itself and
does not catch the any interface changes.

This commit improves its unit tests so that used interfaces can
be covered at more deeper level.

Now at least all service clients updates can be captured in UT.

Change-Id: I0a38a0a64a51fd99fbf11be64e66db0aeea1e13d
'}]
commit_message:
Improve Javelin CLI UT

Now grenade does not use Javelin CLI for upgrade testing, which makes
this CLI untested on gate and there were some maintainability issues of this
CLI.

Till Tempest own this CLI, we should maintain the same.

For any modifications in interfaces used by this CLI, for example on
service clients etc, this CLI needs to be updated accordingly.
But it is always missed due to no failure on gate and it is very hard to
catch the required updates while review.

Unit tests are also not so effective as they mock the OS client itself and
does not catch the any interface changes.

This commit improves its unit tests so that used interfaces can
be covered at more deeper level.

Now at least all service clients updates can be captured in UT.

Change-Id: I0a38a0a64a51fd99fbf11be64e66db0aeea1e13d

commit_message:
Fix javelin script for multiple issues

There are multiple issues in Javelin script for
using service clients.

This CLI was missed to update while doing separation of service clients.
Currently grenade does not use this for upgrade testing So gate cannot
detect those issue.

Later UT should be improved to cover its stability as much as possible.

Change-Id: Iadd9ff44b9772f7ff17d303f7d5605ddbc7a655c

subject: zuul/layout/puppet: switch ovb to multinode for some modules
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-28 19:30:35.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "zuul/layout/puppet: switch ovb to multinode for some modules

For some modules, we don't need to test baremetal deployment.
Actually, only Nova and Ironic do. So let's keep ovb job for them.

Though for the others, use nonha-multinode-nv which is faster and
will allow us later to use it in gate maybe (voting).

Also add the jobs to puppet-mistral and puppet-zaqar, that are deployed
by TripleO.

Change-Id: I4413a9054e0b2aacfec1097588461ff1e7b3f4fb
"}]
commit_message:
zuul/layout/puppet: switch ovb to multinode for some modules

For some modules, we don't need to test baremetal deployment.
Actually, only Nova and Ironic do. So let's keep ovb job for them.

Though for the others, use nonha-multinode-nv which is faster and
will allow us later to use it in gate maybe (voting).

Also add the jobs to puppet-mistral and puppet-zaqar, that are deployed
by TripleO.

Change-Id: I4413a9054e0b2aacfec1097588461ff1e7b3f4fb

commit_message:
Remove the wapper method show_quota_usage()

show_quota_usage() is just a wrapper method of show_quota_show(),
so it is not necessary to implement it as a library.
This patch removes it and makes tests switch to use show_quota_show()
directly.

Change-Id: Ieaa7650a9e975b5dc15575fd68235d83229e5d6c

Update all SHAs for 13.3.1

subject: Fix the issue that strings written with multi line in a html file are not translated
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-02 02:11:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix the issue that strings written with multi line in a html file are not translated

In https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1592965,
extracted messages are stored with trimming. Because of this change,
some strings like written with multi line won't be translated.
This change cause the difference between the real strings in html
and a key in pot, from the view point of extra spaces and break lines.
And it seems to be difficult to remove extra spaces and 'break lines'
when a translation is done. So this patch remove the process of removing
white spaces when extracting messages from html files, even though it may
be annoying for translators again (The comment from the i18n perspective
is Akihiro's comment in patch 3).
If there is better way to address this issue, please teach me.

Change-Id: Ib7dea924b28e1aa4c2a05425363f85db1ef5192d
Closes-Bug: #1606837
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the issue that strings written with multi line in a html file are not translated

In https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1592965,
extracted messages are stored with trimming. Because of this change,
some strings like written with multi line won't be translated.
This change cause the difference between the real strings in html
and a key in pot, from the view point of extra spaces and break lines.
And it seems to be difficult to remove extra spaces and 'break lines'
when a translation is done. So this patch remove the process of removing
white spaces when extracting messages from html files, even though it may
be annoying for translators again (The comment from the i18n perspective
is Akihiro's comment in patch 3).
If there is better way to address this issue, please teach me.

Change-Id: Ib7dea924b28e1aa4c2a05425363f85db1ef5192d
Closes-Bug: #1606837

trunk: avoid redundant refetch of subports on create

Instead of triggering refetch for added sub ports, just populate the
sub_ports fields with objects we already have.

Partially-Implements: bp/adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
Pull out upstream mysql grant provider

* switch to employ account-management statements to modify
  the grant tables indirectly
* remove redundant "flush privileges" from user provider
  since server notices all the changes and loads the tables
  into memory again immediately

Change-Id: I28dcfd0c932a9e438cd6cf00fdeb5fa19fd0431e
Closes-Bug: #1509069
(cherry picked from commit 955e78f3f78f74725e5b908c840c4aa03cae6911)

commit_message:
Save MAC address of the bridge

If the bridge has no ports initially, it will have a generated
MAC address. Save the MAC address to the bridge interface
configuration file. This will ensure persistence of the
physical address.

Change-Id: I4e7e40ceeaee04bf6de70fc3a0d788685c67231c
Related-bug: 1576150

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-01 13:14:29.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.pp'], 'message': 'Set net_ticktime to default 60 seconds

Setting it to lower value causes premature split brain detection, which
RabbitMQ starts to handle. The handler seems to be far from beeing
bug-proof and can result a number of error conditions.

Closes-Bug: #1598154
Change-Id: I2b6e41a60288f7280c3d3f0af9cd0746b3ec6d6e
'}]
commit_message:
Set net_ticktime to default 60 seconds

Setting it to lower value causes premature split brain detection, which
RabbitMQ starts to handle. The handler seems to be far from beeing
bug-proof and can result a number of error conditions.

Closes-Bug: #1598154

commit_message:
When graph is downloaded, remove redundant field "task_name"

There were two parameters with the same value: `id` and `task_name`
which are coming from api. For CLI output one of them is redundant
so `task_name` is removed and `id` is left.

Also task_name will be removed from nailgun API

Change-Id: Ieda5756c526bf3c15e189909f92646c2993d8c6d
Partial-Bug: #1563851

commit_message:
Set node status ERROR when physical id is none

When creating node, sometimes it doesn't return physical id of the node.
Now, we just return false, but the node status is still CREATING.
I think we may set node status ERROR.

Change-Id: I56c681cff04bef5b9193383886cf9b482130ce39
Closes-Bug:#1606843

revisions:
[{'number': 24, 'created': '2016-08-01 13:33:23.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/common_functions.sh', 'scripts/deploy.sh', 'toci_gate_test.sh'], 'message': 'Implement a new job for undercloud testing only

- Add $OVERCLOUD variable to whether or not deploy Overcloud in
  scripts.deploy.sh
- Add $OSINFRA variable to know if we use OpenStack Infra nodes or not.
- Source overcloudrc only if it does exist.
- Create a new job definition for "undercloud" where we disable
  Overcloud setup and use OpenStack Infra nodes.
- Set UNDERCLOUD_SANITY_CHECK to 1 so we can validate undercloud sanity.

Depends-On: Ifce6c253db004a98f8feb51b84a2f1731253f178
Change-Id: Id5556dc0a9472ee38867727c3991c903c801f164
'}]
commit_message:
Implement a new job for undercloud testing only

- Add $OVERCLOUD variable to whether or not deploy Overcloud in
  scripts.deploy.sh
- Add $OSINFRA variable to know if we use OpenStack Infra nodes or not.
- Source overcloudrc only if it does exist.
- Create a new job definition for "undercloud" where we disable
  Overcloud setup and use OpenStack Infra nodes.
- Set UNDERCLOUD_SANITY_CHECK to 1 so we can validate undercloud sanity.

Depends-On: Ifce6c253db004a98f8feb51b84a2f1731253f178
Change-Id: Id5556dc0a9472ee38867727c3991c903c801f164

subject: Fixed bug RequestObject has no attribute `fuzz_request`
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-01 22:47:38.000000000', 'files': ['syntribos/clients/http/parser.py'], 'message': 'Fixed bug RequestObject has no attribute `fuzz_request`

We were returning a new object from http parser each time,
causing init_req.fuzz_request to fail, as it is added later,
new object will not have it. This caused fuzz tests to fail,
fixing it

Change-Id: I8c2c717628bce3f14a85bacad2d4bcd654dbb835
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed bug RequestObject has no attribute `fuzz_request`

We were returning a new object from http parser each time,
causing init_req.fuzz_request to fail, as it is added later,
new object will not have it. This caused fuzz tests to fail,
fixing it

Change-Id: I8c2c717628bce3f14a85bacad2d4bcd654dbb835

"}]
commit_message:
Fixed string check KeyError

Since the 'failed_strings' key in the data dict for the string presence check
was inconsistently named in the check and the tests, an exception was being
thrown every time this signal was thrown by the check.

Change-Id: I3ab24949a5896312900053e0c2bb4954764255ee

commit_message:
[zmq] Use zmq.IMMEDIATE option for round-robin

This options helps to prevent message loss by scheduling
messages only to a connected queue. If there is no connections
socket hangs waiting.

Change-Id: I87b97c8b77887f53599a28e0d05fc2c71c149499
Closes-Bug: #1606272

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-08-01 20:30:55.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/policies/bugs.rst', 'doc/source/stadium/sub_project_guidelines.rst'], 'message': 'stadium: adopt openstack/releases in subproject release process

The openstack/releases repository is open for all official deliverables
(including stable releases for previous cycles), not just
release-with-milestone ones, and we are expected to update the repo in
addition to pushing signed git tags.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/095225.html

With that, streamlined the release request process to avoid Launchpad
from the release scheme: new release requests are tracked and managed in
gerrit only. A new request now starts with a patch for
openstack/releases that should be handled by neutron-release team
members and approved by release liaison before merged by global
OpenStack release team.

Branch creation/expiration is still funneled through LP.

While at it, also suggest switching version numbering to SemVer at
earliest convenience.

Change-Id: Ifcae4b596bc27f7fc8a315e3807144ea03fbb83c
'}]
commit_message:
stadium: adopt openstack/releases in subproject release process

The openstack/releases repository is open for all official deliverables
(including stable releases for previous cycles), not just
release-with-milestone ones, and we are expected to update the repo in
addition to pushing signed git tags.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/095225.html

With that, streamlined the release request process to avoid Launchpad
from the release scheme: new release requests are tracked and managed in
gerrit only. A new request now starts with a patch for
openstack/releases that should be handled by neutron-release team
members and approved by release liaison before merged by global
OpenStack release team.

Branch creation/expiration is still funneled through LP.

While at it, also suggest switching version numbering to SemVer at
earliest convenience.

Change-Id: Ifcae4b596bc27f7fc8a315e3807144ea03fbb83c

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-25 23:00:07.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/iptables_firewall.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_iptables_firewall.py'], 'message': 'Avoid duplicate ipset processing for security groups

While applying firewall rules for ports, existing implementation
iterates through each port and applies ipset for its security groups.
With this, when ports share the security group, ipset for same security

From the DB, we already get the list of security groups for which ipset

commit_message:
Avoid duplicate ipset processing for security groups

While applying firewall rules for ports, existing implementation
iterates through each port and applies ipset for its security groups.
With this, when ports share the security group, ipset for same security
group is called again and again while iterating through ports.

From the DB, we already get the list of security groups for which ipset
members have to be updated. In the new approach, we apply ipset on these
security groups(before firewall rules setup), instead of iterating
through all ports(during settig up firewall rules)and parsing them for
security groups and then applying ipset. With this we can avoid
duplicate ipset processing for same security groups.

Closes-bug: #1598734
Partial-Bug: #1499177
Change-Id: I3f16d1a3a847e706ff743a8e1a5e7598f9f4c6dd
(cherry picked from commit ca792b0d569ca9d55617d6fddfdb53a743c05661)

This will allow use of the keystone library for creating users, such as

Since a role can only get granted to either a project or domain at one

commit_message:
Support users without projects in keystone library

Update the ensure_user, ensure_user_role, and ensure_group_role commands
and dependent functions to allow creation of and role assignment to a
user without specifying a project.
This will allow use of the keystone library for creating users, such as
the heat stack admin, within only a domain.

Since a role can only get granted to either a project or domain at one
time, only attempt to grant the role within the project if both are
provided.

Notifications of state changes for the ensure role commands have also
been fixed.

Backport for change I6a132e5407c9881a047037b85bd6e25b85c0d8a1

Partial-Bug: 1579612
Change-Id: If515ec94e980365ebd38781498ee541df2f3d431

commit_message:
Add the galera_client dependency to the repo build

This change is required because without it the client libraries
used to build the MySQL-Python packages will depend on the base
system and they will be wrong.

In the original backport, galera_client was set as a dependency
of the repo_build role. However, due to galera_client's
dependency on pip_lock_down in liberty, the galera_client role
must be invoked with pip_no_index=false.

This is an example of the issue:
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/543424/

This is the same command when this fix is in place:
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/543436/

Backport for change I6536993523f02ba49da741b9ea21535eb33fe402

Change-Id: I8e62bf2e09217e5fb47d021dfa7f754c09297c62
Closes-Bug: #1565128

commit_message:
Correctly report available for ADFS plugin

The ADFS plugin doesn't correctly catch when lxml is not available. This
will fail when a user then tries to iterate all available plugins.

Closes-Bug: #1608169
Change-Id: Ie9d228751306e6df24b43a62392a8f903f82ab82

commit_message:
Add API tests for router and DHCP port status

Add API tests that ensure DHCP ports and router interface ports
become active.

Router gateway ports were excluded because deployments using
'external_network_bridge = br-ex' will always have their external
interface in the DOWN state.

Related-Bug: #1590845
Related-Bug: #1605955
Change-Id: I843f9217a3c401e8221c9dd42cbd4ea55dcd7a81

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-21 16:27:17.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/shell.py', 'openstackclient/identity/client.py'], 'message': 'Move the auth parser options into shell

The auth params are being added to the shell via the identity client.
This is not really correct (and was unintuitive to me) as auth

identity commands.

Change-Id: I7e727d8b806db2aacc70160e7da461ddb1577bc9
'}]
commit_message:
Move the auth parser options into shell

The auth params are being added to the shell via the identity client.
This is not really correct (and was unintuitive to me) as auth
parameters are going to always be added to the shell not just for
identity commands.

Change-Id: I7e727d8b806db2aacc70160e7da461ddb1577bc9

commit_message:
Initialise oslo.privsep early in main

Any process using oslo.privsep should now initialise the library before
first use with things like the rootwrap command to use.

This should be done near the top of main() in any command that expects
to make privileged calls via oslo.privsep (eg: nova-compute, and not
nova-api).

See I3ea73e16b07a870629e7d69e897f2524d7068ae8 for the corresponding
change in oslo.privsep.

Change-Id: I3a52f762deb176fe9201b2a0f0da363057f8aaec
Depends-On: I52259e2023e277e8fd62be5df4fd7f799e9b36d7
Closes-Bug: #1592043

commit_message:
[Core] Make iterations numeration starting from `1'

As discussed on daily meeting, iterations numbers
in logging and reports must be synchronized and
starting from `1'

Change-Id: I5967c51b033e1a98f2617c5aa8f8e7916de90a08

commit_message:
Add cancelled state to executions

Allow workflow executions to be cancelled and propagate state up for
subworkflows and with-items task. Cancelled workflow executions are
subject to expiration.

Change-Id: I74925105420e84c0b164f83b76edaa9b1612b5d5
Implements: blueprint mistral-cancel-state

commit_message:
assertEqual can be used instead of assertListEqual

Other parts of the code uses assertEqual(). assertEqual() is able
to handle dict, list, set and so on. So we just call assertEqual()
to make the entire code simpler.

Change-Id: If72bb0fa05d2636046f6156cdebd38a63c2b88f3
